dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image of Earth is actually on a monitor, which is only one of DOZENS of MONITORS covering a huge wall. We don't see anything of the rest of the room, but the technology in view is distinctly alien and bizarre -- a mixture of organic and mechanical elements. Circuitry and optical cabling are side-by-side with what looks almost like arteries and organs. We can still hear the creepy skittering and gurgling noises. Occasionally, a SHADOWY FORM sweeps past the camera, vaguely humanoid but we can't tell who or what it is. All of the monitors are active, and they present myriad IMAGES and SOUND -- all related to EARTH HISTORY. The screens show everything from written Chinese... to Renaissance paintings... to black and white newsreel footage of World War Two... to what look like clips of space battles from the 24th century. The entire range of human history dancing across the monitors. The effect is dizzying -- we get the feeling that whoever is watching this is studying the human race. There is another THUMP and the wall of monitors SHUDDERS slightly. We hear the VOICE of what we will come to know as the BORG COLLECTIVE -- thousands of voices speaking at once :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restrict search parameters to 1-9- 9-8 through 2-0-8-4. The images on the monitors now change to show us images from 21ST CENTURY Earth history. Again, it's a collection of still photography, video footage, text, artwork, etc. We hear snippets of sound- bites, music, speeches from the period. A lot of enticing details. As the images race across the monitors, we should learn the following. -- The turn of the 21st century brought chaos. Regional wars, the collapse of the United Nations. Societal break-down. Crime, starvation, desperation. -- A Third World War. Nuclear explosions, environmental disasters, tens of millions dead. The United States ceases to exist. All political authority vanishes. Humanity teetering on the edge of the Second Dark Age. -- The image of a single man -- ZEPHRAM COCHRANE. A visionary scientist. He see the spacecraft he created out of a nuclear missile. He flies the first warp test, breaking the light barrier. It changes history. -- Grainy black and white images of a VULCAN SCOUT SHIP landing on Earth. They saw Cochrane's flight, followed him back to Earth, and made First Contact with the human race. -- Humanity turns the corner. First Contact with an alien civilization brings the planet together as never before. Humans and Vulcans working together, beginning to solve long-standing problems with new technology. We see an early replicator producing food for the starving millions. A new World Government is formed. -- People from planet Earth and people from Vulcan form an Alliance. They call it the United Federation of  Planets. And they commission a fleet of starships for protection and exploration. They call it Starfleet. -- These are images recounting the birth of the Star Trek universe. Another muffled EXPLOSION, this one stronger, SHAKES the entire wall. One of the monitors BLOWS OUT in a shower of sparks. And now a new voice, a woman's voice, low, threatening, with a slight metallic inflection, speaks for the first time:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop search. Calculate temporal coordinates. J-Fourteen. Another explosion ROCKS the room and it takes us to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, spherical Borg warship as it takes a phaser shot from an unseen vessel. The BLAST smashes into the Borg Sphere, but the massive ship continues. The Sphere returns FIRE. FOLLOW the Borg fire to --

dialogues.speaker: A FEDERATION STARSHIP
dialogues.text: locked in battle with the Borg Sphere. The Borg fire DESTROYS the Federation ship in a fiery blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Borg Sphere flies away from the wreckage of the decimated starship, and as it does, we reveal that this is just one small part of --

dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE SPACE BATTLE
dialogues.text: involving dozens of Starfleet and Borg vessels, engaged in a fierce FIREFIGHT as far as the eye can see. Ships turning, twisting, firing, exploding. Lots of movement.  It's a spectacular sight. The Borg Sphere is moving away from the battle, heading off in another direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the battle. A BORG CUBE is attacking a smaller Federation starship. The starship is taking quite a beating... explosions all along the hull... it doesn't look like it can take much  more of this. Suddenly a spread of FOUR TORPEDOES come blazing in from O.C. The torpedoes SLAM into the Borg ship, causing massive damage.

dialogues.speaker: THE USS ENTERPRISE NCC 1701-E
dialogues.text: SOARS into view and moves to protect the beleaguered starship. The Enterprise is Starfleet's newest and most powerful vessel. An elegant and majestic ship. But unlike the last Enterprise, Starfleet has opted for a more muscular vessel and the hull is studded with weapons and other defensive armory. We get the feeling this Enterprise is ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bridge has been redesigned. A single Captain's chair dominates the room, and surrounding consoles and stations all face inward instead of out, giving Picard instant access to his officers. PICARD in the Captain's chair. RIKER at a new Ops station. DATA at the helm. WORF at Tactical. TROI at Communications, various CREWMEMBERS at their posts. The ship is at Red Alert and everyone is tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal the Endeavor to fall back. We'll cover them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. She works her console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE & BORG SHIP The Endeavor moves off as the Borg FIRE at the Enterprise and BLASTS the saucer section. This should also produce an unusual effect -- instead of the traditional "bubble" shielding, the new armor of this Enterprise ABSORBS the blast and dissipates the energy across the hull. The ship is undamaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is ROCKED by the blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispersive armor is holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring us about. Target Borg ship alpha four, port side battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Port battery, ready sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As RAPID PHASER SHOTS leap out from half a dozen points along the ship's port side. (NOTE: The phasers also look different, more along the lines of a gatling gun). The Borg Cube EXPLODES. The Enterprise flies through the debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including MAIN VIEWSCREEN, which has a view of the chaotic battle surrounding them. Another Borg vessel looms into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starboard battery -- fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise fires a burst of phasers -- but this time, the phasers have no effect. We see a strange SHIELDING appears around the Borg ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the main viewer, the massive Borg ship looms closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Borg ship has modified its shields, Captain. Our phasers will no longer be effective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready quantum torpedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Only three left. Another JOLT as we're hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Forge to bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where GEORDI and N.D. Engineers are rushing about, hard at work. Geordi is no longer wearing his VISOR -- he now has artificial ocular implants for eyes. They have a distinctive electronic look to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I'm starting to worry about the hull integrity. We've been running the support field at full power for three hours straight. I don't know how much longer it's going to hold up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. Keep me informed. END INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Borg cube is huge on the main viewer as the Enterprise rushes toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming transmission from the Borg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. Data works and the viewer changes to a view of the INTERIOR of the BORG CUBE. A vast CHAMBER crammed with HUNDREDS of BORG DRONES standing upright in individual alcoves. They're everywhere -- on the ceiling, walls, floor. This is a BORG COLLECTIVE -- hundreds of Borg that form a gigantic "hive" mind. The Borg are half- man/half machine. No individual personalities. No feelings. They have only one goal in life: to assimilate new races into their collective. To become a Borg is to experience living death. When they speak, they speak as a collective -- thousands of voices speaking as one:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your defense perimeter is useless. You will be assimilated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Borg) Break off your attack. By now, you must realize you can't win...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your opinion is irrelevant. We are the Borg. Resistance is futile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see about that... (to Worf) Fire. Worf works.

dialogues.speaker: TORPEDO BAY
dialogues.text: A QUANTUM TORPEDO BLASTS out of the launcher and heads toward the Borg cube. This torpedo is completely different than the traditional photon torpedo. It oscillates and changes shape and color as it streaks  toward the Borg ship.

dialogues.speaker: THE BORG SHIP
dialogues.text: as the quantum torpedo HITS IT. But instead of exploding on the surface, the torpedo PIERCES the ship like an armor-piercing shell and momentarily VANISHES from view. The ship then EXPLODES like a star going supernova -- bright light and shock waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is ROCKED violently by the shock wave. People hanging on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main power still on-line, Captain. Riker looks at his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casualties are light, Captain. Minor buckling on the port nacelle. Nothing serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming message from the Starship Intrepid. Admiral Hayes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. The viewer shows ADMIRAL HAYES on the Bridge of his starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new quantum torpedoes are doing the trick, Jean-Luc. We've destroyed forty-seven Borg ships so far... and only lost fifteen of our own. (beat) But one of the Borg ships has broken through our defenses, and it's heading directly for Earth. Can you handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good hunting. Hayes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Data, set a pursuit course. Maximum warp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it breaks away from the battle...and races INTO WARP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are Starfleet satellites and space stations in close orbit. The Borg Sphere seen before enters frame. The satellites open fire, but they have little effect on the massive Borg Sphere, which returns fire, EXPLODING them in orbit. The Sphere heads down toward the Earth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are approaching the Terran System, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to impulse. Where's the Borg ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has entered Earth orbit. (off console) Correction -- it is not in orbit. It is heading directly toward the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Picard gets up, moves to Data's console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Some sort of suicide tactic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unknown, sir. Suicide tactics are not normally associated with the Borg. Data reacts to his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensors show a temporal signature emanating from the Sphere. High concentrations of tachyons... Picard studies Data's monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And chronometric particles... it's as though they're trying to create a temporal vortex... A beat as Picard makes a shocking realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time travel... they're attempting time travel... (beat) Full power, Mister Data. Worf, quantum torpedoes at my command!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Borg Sphere GLOWING RED and beginning to burn with friction as it PLUMMETS toward Earth...

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: plunging down into the atmosphere, giving chase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range -- fifty kilometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A temporal vortex is forming directly ahead of the Sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ahead of the Sphere we see a TEMPORAL VORTEX opening -- a maelstrom of light and energy stretching into infinity. ENERGY explodes from the vortex as the Sphere begins to go inside...

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: as it's HIT by the tremendous energy blast from the vortex. The ship spins around, nearly rips apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone THROWN to the deck. Consoles sparking. Power failing. SHAKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main power off-line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switching to emergency back-ups. Riker checks a console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're caught in some kind of energy wake from the vortex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf... torpedo... now! Worf works...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another QUANTUM TORPEDO is launched from the Enterprise. But just before it hits the Borg Sphere, the Sphere VANISHES inside the vortex. The torpedo hits the roiling energy of the Vortex and detonates with a harmless flash. The Vortex itself starts COLLAPSING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaking subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have helm control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Sphere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have traveled into the vortex... through time. Disturbed reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vortex is collapsing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact Starfleet Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. (reacts to console)         I'm not reading any Starfleet com traffic in this entire sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) Captain, I've scanned the planet. The atmosphere contains a high concentration of methane, carbon monoxide and fluorine. The oceans have been chemically altered, as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. She works, and on the View screen EARTH appears as seen from orbit. The crystal blue marble is now covered by a thick, turbulent DARK ATMOSPHERE -- polluted and ugly. Reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life signs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Population... thirty-five billion... (reacts) All Borg. A shocking moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) The planet's surface is covered with Borg technology. (beat) So is the moon... and three other planets in this solar system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must've done it in the past... they went back and changed history...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) They did it... they assimilated Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if they changed history... then why are we still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were caught in the temporal wake from the vortex. It must have protected us from any changes in the time-line. Worf's console sounds an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, there are five Borg ships closing in on our position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making a decision) Data, set a course for that vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to follow them back... repair whatever damage they've done to that time-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working) Course laid in. Engaging impulse engines. The ship is suddenly ROCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33   EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE & BORG SHIPS (OPTICAL) The Enterprise is being chased by FIVE BORG SHIPS as it heads down toward the planet. The Borg vessels FIRE on the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before. The ship is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull integrity down to thirty percent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN, (OPTICAL)
dialogues.text: Ahead of the ship, we see the VORTEX collapsing. The shaking increases. A console EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borg vessels are closing to two thousand meters. The ship is HIT AGAIN AND AGAIN. On the View Screen, we're nearly on the vortex, but it's closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36   EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE & VORTEX (OPTICAL) The Enterprise just barely makes it inside the vortex as it finally COLLAPSES. Both the Enterprise and the vortex VANISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty star field. Suddenly, the VORTEX APPEARS and the Enterprise comes ROARING out into space. The vortex VANISHES behind the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaking subsides. Everyone exchanges a look, tries to re-orient themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still in Earth orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: Which shows Earth. The Borg pollution is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What year is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working) According to our astrometric readings... the year is 2063.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I've found the Borg Sphere. It's on the far side of the planet...firing at the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Data) Intercept course, full impulse. (to Worf) Weapons status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phasers are off-line... we have two quantum torpedoes left. But the computer targeting system has been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to manual. Worf pops open a panel and a high-tech TARGETING console emerges with a small MONITOR and a traditional CROSS- HAIR in the center. Worf grabs the targeting hand- controls -- futuristic joysticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is FIRING its weapons down toward the planet as the Enterprise comes up over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before. Worf works his controls. A complex array of grids, coordinate information, speed data, and other weapons info on the monitor screen. He begins trying to focus the cross-hairs on the Sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over above action, to Troi) Track their weapons fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) Western hemisphere... North American continent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are within torpedo range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've seen us. They're taking evasive action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) Mister Worf? Worf struggles with the targeting system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target... The crosshairs keep missing the image of the Borg Sphere, which is now twisting and turning to evade us. Troi reacts to her console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, they're firing at a nuclear missile silo... in central Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Target...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Montana... The crosshairs finally LOCK on the Borg Sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target locked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quantum torpedo streaks in from off-camera and slams into the Borg ship. It penetrates the Sphere as seen before... a long beat... and then it EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As everyone reacts to the destruction of the Sphere. But Picard has no time for celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Data) Mister Data, I want to know the exact date and time. (to Riker) Give me a damage report on that missile silo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (works) Today is March second, 2063. The time in Montana is oh-eight-forty- five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (works) Looks like they damaged the silo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life signs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't tell. Long-range bio- sensors are off-line. Picard thinks for a moment... makes an instant decision and turns to Worf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf, have Doctor Crusher, Mister La Forge and a security team meet me in Transporter Room Three. Civilian clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Worf works. Riker turns to him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In twenty-four hours, Zephram Cochrane is supposed to conduct the very first warp test... from a missile silo in Montana. If I'm right, the Borg were trying to change the course of human history by killing him or destroying his ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods in understanding) And if they succeed, humans won't make First Contact with the Vulcans tomorrow. (beat) As First Officer I should be the one beaming down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, I would agree. But in this case, the mission requires a certain knowledge of 21st century history. You're many things, Number One, but you're not much of an historian. He grins slightly, has to agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep in contact. You have the Bridge. Picard EXITS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Geordi and THREE SECURITY GUARDS are checking their phasers and tricorders. Everyone is wearing civilia clothes. Geordi has a large engineering kit... Transporte Chief pulling on a civilian jacket. She looks a little  frazzled - it's been a long day in Sickbay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will somebody please tell me where  we're going? Beverly joins them on the pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montana. (to Chief) Energize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montana? Well, that answers everything. Why the hell are we -- They DEMATERIALIZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Geordi, Beverly and the Security Team MATERIALIZE on the vast, rolling plains of Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) -- going to Montana? Picard and Geordi take out their tricorders and start scanning the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) I have the silo, sir. Bearing three one zero... distance, three hundred meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. They start walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go where? Hello? Is anyone going to tell me what we're doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to find Zephram Cochrane. He may be injured or dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochrane... the inventor of warp drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's been dead for three hundred... (realizes, long sigh) Oh God... we've gone back in time again, haven't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so. If the Borg succeed in preventing First Contact with the Vulcans... Earth will remain in the Second Dark Age... an easy target when the Borg arrive in the 24th century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why didn't you just say so in the first place? Picard gives her a look. As they keep walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hanging in orbit of Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A DEAD CREWMEMBER lying on her back. A sheet is covering her face. A hand reaches in, pulls back the sheet, revealing the face of a crewman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Sandra Farrel. WIDEN to REVEAL Troi and Data. Data is holding back the sheet while Troi scans the body with a tricorder. There is repair work going on in the b.g. Two medical N.D.s stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears death was caused by a plasma discharge. (beat) I'll note in her record that she never left her post. Troi glances at Data, who is clearly disturbed by the sight of the dead woman, holding his EMOTIONS in check with difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very well. We met shortly after the Enterprise-E was commissioned. I found her to be a most... promising officer. Troi looks at him in concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data... are you sure you're all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am still having difficulty integrating certain emotions into my programming. Grief, loss, remorse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have to make reports on ten more crewmen killed in action. Maybe you should deactivate your emotion chip until we're done. Data considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Human beings do not have that luxury, and neither should I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will admit... there are times when I wish I had an emotion chip I could turn on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker to Data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps combadge) Go ahead, Commander. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker, Worf, N.D.s at their stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're reading some kind of gas leak in the Environmental Control Room. Take a repair team down and check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way, Commander. As Data EXITS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIDE SHOT of the ship. CAMERA CLOSES ON the AFT SECTION of the ship, moving underneath of the hull, pushing in on an area at the very bottom of the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data and ENSIGN PORTER ENTER through a set of doors. The lights are off in the room, dim. This is a large room crammed with many conduits, gas tanks, 24th century machinery and monitors. It's normally unmanned -- this is where oxygen, gravity, heat, and other environmental conditions of the ship are controlled. In a far corner of the room a CONDUIT leading to a series of high-pressure TANKS labeled "D-O2" has ruptured and is SPEWING a corrosive, poisonous GAS. Data scans it with his tricorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Porter) One of the diathermic oxygen tanks has been damaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Diathermic oxygen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a new subsystem of Nova Class ships. It regulates hydropressure and temperature variance. (beat) Remain here. The gas is highly corrosive to organic material. It would liquefy your flesh on contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest, sir. Data walks over to the spewing gas tank, and without concern shoves both hands into the corrosive gas... ... groping around for the broken conduit, finally grabs hold of it... and with android strength BENDS the metal conduit back into the bulkhead. The gas stops leaking. Data is completely unaffected by the corrosive gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Porter) Begin a diagnostic on the safety interlocks. There appears to have been some damage during the attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Porter moves around a corner, behind some equipment, out of Data's vision...

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: who opens a PANEL on the wall. But instead of the neat and orderly Starfleet technology, he is confronted by a bizarre amalgam of organic and mechanical cabling, diodes and what almost look like arteries. Some of the tubes are pulsing with fluids and energy. Porter reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell... Porter pulls aside a large conduit and stops. Buried deep within the tangle of bio-circuits is what looks like a HUMAN FACE covered with cybernetic tubes and chips. It's barely discernable in the darkness and clutter. Porter isn't even sure what he's looking at. He leans in for a closer look... and suddenly the eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: who hears a THUMP and a sickening liquid CRUNCH from off camera. He takes a few steps in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensign Porter? He stands there for a moment, puzzled. Then a faint SKITTERING SCRAPE can be heard -- like tiny claws on a metal surface. He  whirls at the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensign... are you all right? No response. Data walks around the now deathly quiet room... turns the corner to where Porter was working. He's gone. The open panel is still there, and there doesn't appear to be any place Porter could've gone. Data looks puzzled, takes a step forward when his boots make a squishing sound. He looks down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps combadge)          Data to Bridge. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data to Security. (beat) This is Lieutenant Data to anyone who can hear my signal. I need assistance in the Environmental Control Room. Nothing. Data quickly turns and heads for the door. There's a metallic SCRAPE above him and he looks up --

dialogues.speaker: TWO BORG
dialogues.text: are climbing to the ceiling like two spiders ready to pounce. One of them has Porter and appears to be inserting some horrible Borg device into his head. Before Data can react, the second Borg suddenly lunges at Data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SILO is buried deep underground, but on the surface there is a large, poured concrete MISSILE DOOR. Built to withstand a nuclear blast, the door has nevertheless been badly charred and damaged by the Borg attack from orbit. There are large, smoking CRATERS all around. Part of the ground seems to have COLLAPSED to a depth of ten feet, like a sinkhole nearby. Picard and his team approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How serious is the damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) I'm having trouble scanning underground. There's a lot of radiation leaking from something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably from the nuclear warhead. Cochrane was planning to use it to ignite the warp drive. As they speak, Beverly pulls out a hypospray and gives everyone injections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will protect us from the radiation. Geordi moves to the thick, concrete missile door, scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm picking up faint life signs twenty meters below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There should be an access hatch nearby... Everyone spreads out... looking for the hatch. One of the guards -- LANGE -- finds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here. Everyone rushes over to him. There's a small HATCH on the ground that has been partially hidden by weeds and brush. Geordi kneels down, starts working a complex- looking LOCK on the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alphanumeric lock. We need a password to get in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the password right here. Picard pulls out his phaser and everyone steps back. He aims and FIRES at the hatch, which is BLOWN OPEN, revealing a ladder that leads down into the darkness. As they start to crawl inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the "mission control" for Cochrane's test site. The underground room is filled with 21st century equipment, consoles and monitors. One entire wall of the room is dominated by a huge METAL BLAST DOOR, which is now closed. We will learn that on the other side of that door is the nuclear missile/warp ship itself. The ceiling has partially collapsed. Chunks of concrete and fallen beams have destroyed some of the equipment...Only a few of the consoles are active, most are dark or fritzing sporadically. The lights are out, and the room is illuminated by a few smoldering fires. Four dead bodies can be seen strewn around the room. It's a scene of destruction.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: and his team ENTER the dark and smoking ruin. Beverly and Picard move to one of the dead men, while Geordi and the Security Guards move to the other three. Beverly rolls the man onto his back -- he's clearly dead. The name stitched on his uniform says Rippert. Picard looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others) See if any of these men are Cochrane. Geordi and the Guards start checking the dead bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell... DePaul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's a woman... named Kirby. Picard and Beverly move toward the immense blast door. As Beverly scans it, Picard glances at a nearby desk...

dialogues.speaker: THE DESK
dialogues.text: is littered with debris and various documents and schematics. THREE PHOTOGRAPHS are pinned to a bulletin board above the desk -- they show Zephram Cochrane and two angles of his warp ship. The photos are odd- looking, printed on what appears to be some sort of cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a life sign behind this door... about ten meters below. Geordi moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blast door. It's designed to protect the control room when the missile is launched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There should be some kind of manual release... They hunt around for a moment. Geordi runs his hand along the edge of the blast door. Picard turns to the Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lange) Get those fires out and then try to restore main power to the control room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. The Guards move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it, Captain. Geordi has found an emergency BOX with several pneumatic tubes and a hydraulic lever labeled "emergency use only." He pulls down the lever, there is a hissing sound, and the blast door slowly SLIDES DOWN into the floor. We can now see the MISSILE SILO itself beyond the door. Picard, Geordi and Beverly step into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Geordi and Beverly step onto the catwalk, which surrounds the Silo walls. In the middle is the WARP SHIP itself. It should look like an advanced ICBM missile with a COCKPIT in place of the warhead, and with numerous modifications to the fuselage. The cockpit is on the same level as the control room. On the side of the missile is the name "Phoenix". The missile itself extends down another FOUR STORIES. There are other catwalks below this one, with ladders connecting the different levels. Beverly sees something below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two catwalks below we can see a man sprawled on the grating. They all scramble down the ladders past the massive missile. (NOTE: Because of the design of the Silo, we will see the entire missile only in a few shots. For the most part, our view is limited to sections of the missile.) Beverly reaches the man, who is lying face-down on the metal grating. She scans him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Severe radiation exposure... Geordi looks over at the section of the missile on their level. The side panels have been removed, revealing complex circuitry within. Picard joins Beverly, who turns over the injured man. It's ZEPHRAM COCHRANE -- the man whose picture we saw on the Borg monitors. Beverly begins pulling devices out of her medkit, injects Cochrane with a hypospray. Cochrane is a man in his mid-forties. He has a youthful, dynamic appearance marred by recent radiation burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Cochrane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've stabilized him for now... but he's in a coma and he's going to need radiometric therapy. I want to take him to the ship. Picard nods, reaches into his pants pocket, takes out a combadge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard to Enterprise. (no response) Enterprise, please respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be the radiation, Captain. Try from the surface. Picard nods... then takes a deep breath, tries to orient himself to the task at hand... there's a lot at stake and a lot to do. He turns to Geordi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister La Forge, listen very carefully. If you remember your history... in less than twenty- four hours, a Vulcan ship will be passing through this system. When it does, this ship needs to be in space, flying at warp speed. Geordi takes a deep breath, it's a tall order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better get started. Geordi goes to work. Picard bends down and carefully hoists Cochrane up into a fireman's carry. Beverly follows him up the catwalk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minutes later. Cochrane is lying on the ground. Beverly is kneeling beside him, unfolding a portable stretcher from her medkit. Picard is checking two combadges with a tricorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the radiation... and there's nothing wrong with the combadges... the Enterprise just isn't responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Luc, this man needs medical attention, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I recall, the town of Resurrection is about two kilometers East of here. They might have a hospital... Picard looks troubled at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we waiting for? Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may not be that simple. This is an extremely difficult and paranoid time in human history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying they won't help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying they might shoot us on sight. You have to remember... these people have watched their entire way of life collapse around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some good people... even in this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope so. Because if Cochrane dies... the future may die with him. Picard kneels down and they begin to carefully put Cochrane on the stretcher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker, Troi and Worf studying a MONITOR which shows a three-dimensional DIAGRAM of the Enterprise, which turns and rotates as needed. The schematic shows battle damage and repair efforts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have assigned two damage control teams to locate the source of our communication problems. So far, they've had no success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assign another team if you need to. I want to re-establish communication with the Captain as soon as possible. Worf nods and begins making notes on a PADD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we in any danger of being detected by Earth defense systems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were no planetary defense systems in this era. Their weapons were designed to fight each other... not extraterrestrials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to start thinking about a way to get home. (to Troi) Analyze our readings from the temporal vortex. We're going to have to recreate whatever the Borg did to -- Just then the ship SHUDDERS and the LIGHTS FLICKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) We just lost main power... and we've got Class-Three alerts all over the ship. I'm not sure what's -- An ALARM goes off on Worf's console. He reacts to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship-wide decompression has been initiated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're venting our internal atmosphere directly into space!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE SAUCER as vents and hatches POP OPEN on the hull and GIANT JETS OF VAPOR start blowing out into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crewmembers walking along are suddenly KNOCKED to the floor as hurricane force WINDS blow through the Corridor. The ship is venting air into space, creating a virtual VACUUM inside the ship! The people in the corridor grab onto the bulkheads, struggling to hang on against the force of the wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an emergency AIRLOCK on the Bridge OPENS. VIOLENT WIND roars through the Bridge and everyone hangs on. Troi is ripped out of her chair, flown across the Bridge, slams up against the bulkhead, struggling to hang on. Worf runs over, grabs her arm, keeps her from flying out. Riker manages to reach a control panel -- hits a button and an EMERGENCY BULKHEAD finally slides down over the airlock and the wind DIES DOWN. Everyone takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is happening, Worf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) It appears that someone has taken over the Environmental Control Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) The Borg.  Some of them must've beamed over before we destroyed their ship. (to Worf) Seal off that entire deck with emergency force fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wil... Data was down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Worf) Mister Worf... find Data if you can, but your top priority is isolating the Borg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. Worf heads for a Turbolift. OFF Riker's disturbed expression...

dialogues.speaker: DATA'S FACE
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed. There's a beat, then his eyes fly open and he looks around. We PULL BACK slightly, revealing Data is lying on some kind of tabletop with metallic clamps and restraints. He tenses his arm and tries to move, but he is unable to break the restraints. About two feet in front of his face is what appears to be a bulkhead. There is a cacophony of strange background NOISE -- scratching, hisses, gurgling liquids, odd alien hums... Suddenly, the table begins to MOVE. It ROTATES, and as it does so we realize that Data has been hanging upside down staring at the floor. It's a disorienting moment as our perspective changes and Data rotates upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the table gyrates, we REVEAL the ROOM slowly. And we realize we're in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Environmental Control Room seen earlier has now been transformed into the INNER-SANCTUM of the BORG. The room has a dark, moist, organic feel -- a tropical jungle of cybernetic equipment. The Borg are altering the room, converting Starfleet technology and materials into the living, bio- mechanical look of the Borg. We see one Borg drone attach a small pod to a Starfleet console and activate it. The pod immediately sends out a COMPLEX WEB of BORG TECHNOLOGY which covers the Starfleet console inside and out. It's like weeds overpowering a flower bed -- within seconds the console has been BORGIFIED. The walls, ceiling and floor are now honeycombed with the ALCOVES that make up the BORG COLLECTIVE. Borg drones are motionless in their alcoves, cabling and other conduits connecting them to various equipment... while other Borg are moving about the room, carrying out various modifications to the room. At one point, we see Ensign Porter. He's been completely Borgified. His skin pale, expression blank. No hint of humanity left.

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: still strapped to the table, which is twisting and rotating, giving him frightening new glimpses of the room. A new image appears -- SIX BORG DRONES are clustered together in one section of the room, each with an elaborate series of hoses and conduits connected to its face. Through the tubes we can see an exchange of FLUID and ENERGY pulsing back and forth -- some sort of bizarre "feeding" or "renewal" is going on. The tubes all seem to lead toward the ceiling. Data is now horizontal on his back and the table LOCKS into position. A Borg drone OPENS A PANEL on the side of Data's head, and begins connecting a thick bundle of optical cabling to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Borg) Your efforts to assimilate me will be unsuccessful. The Borg ignores him, activates a console... and the cabling connected to Data's head LIGHTS UP with power. They're trying to connect him to the Collective. Data thinks for a moment, tilts his head slightly... and then suddenly there's a SHOWER of SPARKS from the cabling he's been connected to. The lights on the cable go out. Data has thwarted their attempts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Borg) It would appear that resistance is not always futile. Suddenly a new VOICE is heard echoing through the room -- a woman's voice, low, seductive, deadly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave words. I've heard them before from thousands of species across thousands of worlds... since long before you were created. Data looks up toward...

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: A RUSTLE of MOVEMNET somewhere in the cyber-tangle... almost like a snake slithering beneath the weeds. And for a brief instant we get a glimpse of a FACE unlike any Borg we've ever seen. The face of a woman. Pale- skinned... piercing eyes...raven hair slicked back... a hauntingly beautiful image in a sea of nightmarish technology. And then it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: Frowns. He saw it, too, but he's not sure what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now... they are all one with the Borg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am unlike any lifeform you have encountered before. As an android, I am in complete control of my neural net. The information contained there cannot be forcibly removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an imperfect being... created by an imperfect being. Finding your weakness is only a matter of time. Suddenly three Borg drones converge on Data with various wicked-looking Borg devices. One of the Borg has a specialized cybernetic ARM, which EXTRUDES a series of stiletto-tipped DRILL SPIKES. As the six- inch spikes begin to BORE INTO Data's head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resurrection is a small town -- around 1,000 people -- a rural, Western community that's probably existed for at least two hundred years, and we can see the roots of the original ranching community in some of the architecture. But it's also a community of the 21st century. The most striking feature of the town is that it sits in the middle of nearly a hundred WIND MILLS, which provide the only source of power for the town. The blades are enormous, but the structures supporting them are little more than simple poles. Some are sleek, fiberglass, futuristic... others have a more cobbled together, make-shift appearance. At the moment, only a few blades are turning in the gentle breeze. Picard and Beverly emerge from the nearby woods carrying the stretcher. They exchange a look at the sight of the city and then head toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minutes later. Picard and Beverly carrying Cochrane down the street toward the hospital at the end. As they walk along, we get our first taste of post-apocalyptic 21st century life: This is a recognizable American community, but it's definitely a futuristic town. Clothing, architecture, technology -- all have changed over the course of seventy years. But it is a broken future. What used to be high-tech public COMPUTER TERMINALS are rusted and abandoned. We can see the corroded hulks of HOVER- CARS lying idle in the streets. Futuristic elements now useless. At one point, they pass a large polyurethane TENT -- the inside surface is covered with condensation and we can see the silhouettes of people moving within. The entrance is guarded by a single Militia Guard. Later we will learn that this is a primitive greenhouse, the only place where they can grow uncontaminated food. What used to be a McDonald's, or some other recognizable food chain, has now been gutted and has been turned into a kind of blacksmith shop. People are fashioning metal into various tools using hammer and tongs. The sidewalks are populated with PEOPLE, who congregate in small groups, quietly talking amongst themselves, others just staring vacantly off into space. Many of them have visible burn scars and damage to their bodies - victims of the war and post-nuclear environmental dangers. A few of them are applying a special lotion to their arms and face -- protection against the toxic elements. A long FOOD LINE snakes around a block, as people line up to get their daily rations. A few people glance up at Picard and Beverly with curious or suspicious looks. This is not a community that welcomes strangers. At one point, they see a man dressed in futuristic CAMOUFLAGE carrying an automatic weapon -- we will learn he's a MILITIA SOLDIER. He stares at them with a neutral expression, then walks off. The people here have that hollow-eyed, listless look about them. They're going through something that makes the Great Depression look like a minor inconvenience. But there's also a toughness to these people, a resilience and determination to survive in the face of overwhelming odds. We are looking at our future... and it's on the verge of collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short time later. Cochrane is being lifted onto an operating table. Picard and Beverly step back from the table as a DOCTOR and two NURSES look him over. The doctor is in his early fifties and has a weathered, tired look to him. The hospital itself is like the rest of the town -- a futuristic setting fallen on hard times. The light in the room is provided mostly from the sunlight streaming in through the windows. Light bulbs and other gear flicker dimly around the hospital -- we get the feeling they have very little power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has he been unconscious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least four hours. He checks Cochran's head injury as Beverly takes out her tricorder and scans him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like he has a cranial fracture, but I'll need X-rays to be sure. (to Nurse) Get Ruby in here. One of the nurses runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) He has a severe fracture of the left occipital plate. He's not hemorrhaging... but the radiation has damaged his KNA and his APR cell count... He looks at her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "APR cell count?" What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Doctor Crusher has been... studying some advanced medical theories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: tricorder) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a... new medical scanner. It's a little more precise than an X-ray machine. The Doctor eyes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Japanese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... yeah. (beat) Now he's going to need a respirator. Do you have one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have two... but we don't have the juice to run them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power. There hasn't been a lot of wind through here for the last couple of weeks. Most of the batteries are depleted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have any generators, or other fuel sources? The Doctor throws her an irritated look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you'd like to take your patient to the hospital in Bozemen... it's only two hundred miles away. Cochrane wheezes -- breathing becoming labored and ragged. Beverly scans him, urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His automatic reflexes are fluctuating. We've got to get him on a respirator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nurse) Bag him. The nurse picks up a portable respirator sack -- puts it on Cochrane's face and squeezes the bag, forcing air into Cochrane's lungs. Picard has been thinking through this scene, finally has a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly -- your tricorder. She hands him her tricorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doctor) Where's the battery room for the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, there's no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, around back. Next to the water tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard rushes out the doors. Beverly checks Cochrane's pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His heartbeat's irregular...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly climbs up on top of Cochrane, straddling him, begins giving him 24th century CPR. She takes charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrenaline -- ten CC's! As they rush to save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the building. Picard rushes out and spots an old, dilapidated BATTERY UNIT providing power to the hospital. He quickly yanks off the back panel, revealing a tangle of wires, and several large batteries. He kneels down, then removes the back of the tricorder.

dialogues.speaker: TRICORDER
dialogues.text: as Picard pulls out a small POWER CELL -- about half the size of a dime. The blinkies on the tricorder go out.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: holds the power cell with one hand, and starts pulling out wires from the batteries with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before. Beverly, the doctor and the nurse trying to save Cochrane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pumping his chest) One... two... three... compress! The nurse squeezes the bag. Suddenly the room is filled with the HUM of POWER and ALL OF THE LIGHTS AND EQUIPMENT COME TO LIFE. Monitors blinking, fluorescent lights flashing on. Everyone reacts with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's filled with patients. The lights and equipment here FLASH ON, as well. Doctors and patients alike react with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard enters. They've placed a RESPIRATOR down Cochrane's throat, and attached electrodes to his chest. Beverly has just finished giving him an injection with a hypospray. The heart monitor in the background is now beating regularly. The doctor turns to Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to the batteries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... just a little tinkering. How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stable... for now. (with meaning) But it would be better if we could contact... our friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But until then, you'll have to make do with what you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be interesting. A WOMAN'S VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him? Everyone turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: revealing RUBY SLOANE standing at the front of Cochrane's bed. A striking woman in her mid-to-late thirties -- dark hair, tall, lean, beautiful under normal circumstances but at the moment she's not at her best, it looks like she's just come in from a hard day's work. She's wearing an old lab coat. But the most striking quality of all is the innate intelligence we can see in her eyes. She's looking directly at Picard for an answer. Picard realizes he has to say something. He looks into her eyes and there is a moment here -- a brief spark of chemistry that in normal circumstances the Captain just might follow up. But at the moment, he shoves that electric feeling aside and tries to give her an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was some kind of explosion out at the missile silo... She looks at him for a moment, her eyes boring into him without expression, as though probing the truthfulness of his statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby, we're going to need a series  of cranial X-rays tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I have a fresh set of plates at home. I'll have them here by eight. She turns back to Cochrane, moves to his side, gently takes his hand and looks at him with sad affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Take care of him. He's a very special man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is. She looks up at Picard, and again there's a slight feeling of chemistry in the air. And then she turns and starts to walk out of the room. Picard's combadge BEEPS. Reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Forge to Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) I think there's someone in your pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I have a... telephone call. Picard takes a few steps away, pulls the combadge out of his pants pocket, taps it. Ruby watches him a beat, then walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we have a problem. I think you'd better get back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way. Picard out. Picard moves to Beverly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I have to go back to the silo. Will you be all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. (re: Cochrane) He's a different story. Beverly begins examining the medical equipment she'll have to work with as Picard exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short time later. Picard walking down the main street back toward the gates. People passing him, taking no notice of him...Picard's mind thinking ahead. He happens to glance down a side street, then he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down the side street. Ruby, the mysterious woman from the hospital, is walking along with a camera bag now slung over her shoulder. She stops for a moment as she passes the hulk of a burnt-out old hover car... stares at it...then pulls a home-made FUTURISTIC CAMERA out of her bag and snaps a picture of the car. She continues on her way. Picard is intrigued -- wonders about this woman and what it is she could be taking a picture of. Just then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch. Picard turns just in time to catch a small, metal canister with a screw-top. The man who threw it steps into view. It's LIEUTENANT SCRIMM. Scrimm is the head of the town's militia. While not a physically threatening man, there is a quietly disturbing quality about him which conveys an intelligence laced with a tightly reined volatility. He's wearing futuristic combat fatigues and always carries a sidearm. Before the war, Scrimm was probably one of the "survivalists" who used to be dismissed as radicals until their predictions of Armageddon came true. At the moment, Scrimm is presenting his friendliest face to Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasant) Think you'll need that. Picard eyes the canister, not sure what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no zone solution. (off his look) You know. "No ozone." He points to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...  yes... ultraviolet protection. Thank you. Mister...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, actually. Lieutenant Jonathan Scrimm. I'm the head of the Resurrection Protective Force. (beat) And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Luc Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great name. French?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't sound French. Scrimm is still smiling at him, but his eyes never leave Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raised in England and here in the States. Thank you for the... no zone. Picard begins to walk away, not wanting to engage any citizens of the town. Scrimm falls in next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in the States?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... here and there. You know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I was born and raised right here. Never had much use for travel. He casually steps in front of Picard, blocking his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from most recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking fast) California. San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful city. Used to be, anyway. I didn't think anyone still lived there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a few of us left. Picard steps around him and continues walking down the street. Scrimm waits a beat, then walks after him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a pretty clever trick you did with the hospital's batteries. How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a trick. I used to be an electrical engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. He steps in front of Picard again, still pleasant but a little bit of a smile fading from his face. Picard realizes he isn't going to shake this man so easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what were you doing out at the missile silo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old friend of Cochrane's... I wanted to see how he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for him you came by when you did. He might be dead now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can tell me what he's been doing in that silo. We heard some explosions out there this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was running a test on an old rocket engine... and one of the fuel cells burst. Scrimm eyes him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to have an answer for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. A tense beat. Then Scrimm smiles easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: balm) Be sure you put that on. You need a lot of protection around here. He holds Picard's eyes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. But I've never had much trouble protecting myself. Now it's Picard's turn to smile pleasantly at Scrimm. Picard walks around him and heads for the gates. Scrimm watches him go with a thoughtful expression -- clearly, he's more than a little suspicious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in orbit of Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf and a large SECURITY DETACHMENT -- a dozen or so men and women -- are moving down the Corridor with grim looks on their faces. They are carrying new powerful- looking phaser rifles and other equipment. The feeling is of an elite combat squad heading for a dangerous mission. They stop at one point and Worf lifts up a DECKPLATE, exposing a large HATCH in the floor. Worf hits his combadge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf to Bridge. We're in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker in command, Troi nearby. Riker is standing at the security station looking at a monitor which displays a schematic graphic of the ship. The position of the security team is flashing -- we can see they are on Deck 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Bridge. I'm releasing the emergency force fields. He nods to Troi, who works a console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf and his team watch as the FORCEFIELD protecting the hatch flashes off. Worf reaches down and releases the hatch, which slides open with a soft whoosh. He glances at his men for a moment, then JUMPS down the hatch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Worf lands on his feet. The light is dim, no power on this deck, hard to see. He looks around warily for a moment, phaser at-the-ready, then activates his wrist beacon. We immediately notice that we can see Worf's breath -- it's freezing cold down here. He shines the light around the darkened corridor, then silently motions his arm for the others to follow. A beat, then we see the security officers start to drop into the corridor from the hatch above...

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: As Worf's squad spreads out along the hall, weapons at- the-ready, everyone alert with fingers on the triggers. We see that the phaser rifles are equipped with their own light sources, intended to illuminate the target before you shoot at it. The Security Officers are constantly moving their lights back and forth through the chilly air. Worf gives hand signals -- holds up two fingers, then a fist, and points forward. Two Guards trot down the corridor about fifteen feet, stop, and take up firing positions... then two more members of the team run down, leap frog ahead of them and take positions further down the corridor. Classic military deployment. Worf starts scanning with a tricorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hits combadge) Worf to Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a dampening field in place on this deck. Our tricorders are useless. The team continue to explore Deck 47. It's spooky, eerie, a sense of menace around every corner. They open doors, check room by room, section by section, still no sign of the Borg in the freezing cold darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: The Corridor directly ahead has been stripped of wall, ceiling and deck panels -- all the normal decorative Enterprise sheathing is gone, revealing the circuitry and machinery of the ship itself. Unlike the rest of the corridors, there does appear to be POWER flowing through some of the conduits up ahead, and it gives off an eerie glow. We can also see that some of the machinery has been altered and changed -- not just the neat and orderly arrangement you'd expect to find behind bulkheads -- there's a sense of cross-circuitry, re-wiring, equipment being rearranged. Clearly, a lot of work has gone on in this area of the ship. Worf steps forward, examines the corridor closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borg... Worf signals the team forward, and they slowly begin picking their way down the Borgified Corridor. It's not easy -- they have to choose their footing carefully as they walk through the maze of cables, circuits, and machinery... Ensign Hawk accidentally steps on some circuitry, which gives off a BEEP. The entire team suddenly whirls their lights and weapons on the unfortunate Ensign, who pales at their sudden attention. Worf looks irritated, then motions his team to continue their search. They continue making their way down the spooky corridor... and as they turn a corner...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: where the machinery is now THICKER and more BORG-LIKE in appearance. Tubes and cabling hang down from the ceiling. If anything, it's even colder in here. The deeper they go, the worse it gets. We can now hear a low, sinister HUM of alien power. At the end of this corridor is the ENVIROMENTAL CONTROL ROOM, as seen earlier. The entire doorway is gone -- and a weird pulsing GLOW fills the room. Worf stops his team at the sight. From this vantage, we cannot see directly into the room, but clearly something is going on in there. Worf signals his men to spread out, and they take up positions around the Corridor, all weapons trained on Environmental Control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf to Bridge. We're about to enter the Environmental Control Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of Data, or the Borg themselves? As Work and Riker continue talking, we MOVE TO Ensign Hawk, who is now the last man in the formation, covering the rear. He's shining his phaser-beacon into the empty darkness. He can't help looking back over his shoulder at the rest of the team and the distant Environmental Control Room -- that seems to be where the action is. As he turns, his beacon moves with him, throwing the Corridor behind them in and out of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Negative. However, they've reconfigured the ODN network... and re-routed all power on this deck into Environmental Control. As Worf speaks, Ensign Hawk turns back, but this time when he shines his beacon into the darkness, something MOVES in the distance -- a shadow. The Ensign freezes, brings his rifle up. But did he see it, or was it his imagination? A tense beat as he waits, heart pounding... but nothing happens. On the wall next to his head we see what can only be described as a BIO-MECHANISTIC CABLE creeping out of the wall... which begins slowly heading for the Ensign's neck. Just as he begins to sense that something is happening behind him, the cable WHIPS OUT around his neck and YANKS him deep into the bed of circuitry in the blink of an eye -- the motion so fast we have trouble following it. Worf turns his head at the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by, Commander (to team) Where's Ensign Hawk? Everyone looks around, surprised that he's not there. Everyone is alert, keyed up. The tension is thick. Utter silence, except for the hum of the machinery and the frosty breathing of the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf? Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is very wrong, Commander. We're falling back. Worf gives hand signals for the team to move out. But just as they start to fall back, everything happens at once.

dialogues.speaker: BORG DRONES
dialogues.text: EXPLODE OUT OF THE WALLS, CEILING AND FLOOR! What follows is a BLUR of action happening so fast and furious we never get a true sense of what's happening. A flurry of violence and motion and images: -- A snarling Borg face -- half-human, half-machine, a cybernetic nightmare. -- Strange, bio-mechanical WEAPONS extruding from Borg bodies, RIPPING into human flesh. -- A crewmember PULLED into a bed of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire at will! But the Borg are already on top of them. It's a brutal fight in close quarters with no escape. Phasers and Borg lasers lighting up the corridor, bodies flying through the air... utter chaos and terror. The fight goes hand to hand and Worf sees that they don't have a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing off a Borg) Fall back! The team starts backpedaling, FIRING as they go...but the Borg are unstoppable now -- they put up personal force fields to protect themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, GO! Worf pushes his men down the corridor. Everyone turns and RUNS like hell. Worf bends down and grabs a frightened Lieutenant by the collar, pulling him along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The team running through the corridors, SHOOTING behind them at the pursuing Borg, to no effect... -- Two of the Borg raise their arms and FIRE LASER BURSTS out of their arms and wrists, taking DOWN two Security Guards. Worf sees them fall but there's no time to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Worf's team starts CLIMBING UP and out the dark hatch in the floor seen earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last member of Worf's team climbs out to safety. The Borg swarm is about to overpower Worf. He quickly hits a few controls on his phaser, sets it to overload. We hear the building WHINE. He JUMPS straight up into the air, GRABBING onto the hatch rim, pulling himself up. He barely manages to vanish from view just as the phaser EXPLODES in a FIERY BLAST, taking out several of the Borg drones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conclusive BLAST comes up through the hatch, causing Worf to duck for a moment. Worf reaches out to close the hatch, when a BORG HAND  bursts up from below and GRABS his forearm. It's a  test of strength. Worf reaches over with his other arm, hits a control and the hatch SLIDES CLOSED, SEVERING the Borg arm in a shower of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf to Bridge -- force fields! The force field FLASHES into place. Worf and his team sit there a moment, catching their breath, stunned at what they've just been through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened down there, Worf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander... we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Worf's shaken expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi and Picard are walking down the catwalk ladders toward the missile's massive engines. Now that the smoke has cleared and the place has been cleared up a bit, we get our first good look at the ship and the damage done in the Borg attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the move) Cochrane was going to use this solid rocket booster to lift the ship into orbit. Before the warp drive took over... everything would depend on these old chemical engines. (beat) Now here's the problem... They arrive at a point on the fuselage where we can see a large section of the engines have been BLASTED AWAY, leaving a deep, ugly SCAR -- broken conduit lines, wires that now lead to nothing. It's clear that a key piece of equipment has been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: damage) This used to be the throttle valve assembly. (observing it)   It controls the thrust of the engines. It's been completely vaporized... and without it, there's no way to launch the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you reconstruct the throttle valve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... if I knew what it looked like. There's probably five hundred ways to design a valve like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to launch this ship in under eighteen hours... (beat) There must be some design schematics... blueprints...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're tearing this place apart looking for them... but the computers are down, and the fires destroyed half the files...so far, nothing. They look at the damage in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was just part of the warp drive, I'd know what to do. But this... it's like trying to rebuild Orville Wright's airplane with canvass and sticks. Picard thinks, remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Picard and Geordi are looking at the three cloth-printed photographs seen earlier -- the headshot of Cochrane and two different angles of the three cloth-printed photographs seen earlier -- the warp ship with people working on it. Picard spreads them out on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I looked at these already. Geordi points to a photo of the ship -- a worker is walking in front of the throttle assembly, blocking most of it from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can almost see the throttle assembly in this one... but this guy walked in front of it when they took the picture. Picard considers, absently sticks his hand in his jacket pocket. He pulls out the canister of balm Scrimm gave him and tosses it onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you reconstruct the throttle from a photograph like this... if that man wasn't blocking the view? Geordi thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... (beat) Sure. Yeah. As long as I could get a clear look at the intake configuration. But so far, we haven't found any other photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at photos) If there are other photographs... I think I may know how to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a while later, and the Borg are making progress. Data is strapped to the table, PANELS open on his HEAD and CHEST. Three Borg drones are working methodically on his inner-circuitry. The jagged voice of the woman cuts in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your resistance is... illogical. To us, your neural net is simply another piece of technology. We will learn its secrets. Data stares at the murky ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Borg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a contradiction. The Borg act as a collective consciousness. There are no individuals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the beginning... the end. I am the one who is many. I am the Borg. Out of the mist that hugs the top of the room DESCENDS the BORG QUEEN. She is unlike any of the Borg drones we've ever seen -- a humanoid female with conduits and tubes running out of her body. She has no legs. Her torso is SUSPENDED by a complex rig of CABLES and HYDRAULICS. Her face and upper-torso are much more humanoid, with the pasty- pale white of Borg flesh. Her EYES have a silvery glint to them. Her demeanor is seductive and sensual in contrast to the harsh, mechanical surroundings. She is an eerie blend of two worlds -- organic and mechanical.
