With the soft HISS of hydraulics, she LOWERS herself down to where her face is very close to that of Data's. Her features are almost angelic, but the silvery glint in her eyes betrays an inner-darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the guiding intelligence behind the Borg...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intelligence... ambition... desire... I bring order to chaos... She studies his face with a certain child-like quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unfortunate we will have to destroy you to obtain the information we need. You are a... unique lifeform. (beat) Synthetic... and yet far more than a simple automaton. You have no idea how close to perfection you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him intently, and we get the hint that her interest in Data may go beyond simple assimilation. She seems fascinated by him. Data picks up on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you define perfection? The Queen opens her arms slightly, clearly indicating herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blending of the organic and the synthetic. The highest form of life in the galaxy. Data eyes her, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An interesting definition. But it is not one that applies to me. I am completely artificial. I have no organic components. She looks at him as a new thought crosses her mind. She might've just found the chink in Data's armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever wondered what it's like to have flesh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is impossible to imagine sensations for which I have no frame of reference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That... can change. The Queen looks to the three Borg drones and gives them a silent command. The drones immediately stop working on Data's open panels... and shift their attention to his right ARM. One of the drones tears off the sleeve on Data's uniform, exposing his bare arm. Another then uses a small cutting device to SLICE OFF the synthetic skin from Data's arm. As Data prepares himself for the worst...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE armored SECURITY GUARDS with phaser rifles run into view, hit a control panel on the wall. A giant EMERGENCY BULKHEAD comes SLAMMING down, cutting off the rest of the corridor. The security guards turn to run down the hall, but then there is a high-pitched shriek of wrenching metal. They drop to the deck and take combat stances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set phasers to rotating modulation! They make adjustments to their weapons just as the bulkhead doors EXPLODE INWARD in a blinding flash. The guards shield themselves against the fire and debris... looks up just in time to see the swift and lethal shapes of the BORG jumping through the smashed bulkhead, racing down the corridor toward them. The guards FIRE, and when they do the PHASER BLASTS alternate color -- red, blue, green, purple, orange -- a staccato of colors as the phasers shift frequency. The phaser blasts TAKE DOWN a few of the BORG... but then we see the distinctive PERSONAL FORCEFIELDS of the other Borg begin to compensate, and the phasers no longer affect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, they've adjusted -- fall back! They turn to run but BORG PHASER FIRE lances out from the Borg soldiers and RIPS them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood is tense, grim. Riker, Worf and Troi are gathered around a SCHEMATIC of the ENTERPRISE. The lower portion of the ship has been blocked off by  the color RED, representing the Borg advance through the ship. A they watch, another section of compartments and corridors suddenly turn RED. Riker lets out a wary breath, starts pointing to various points along the schematic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... we've lost control of eight decks... three Cargo Bays... one Shuttlebay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have any idea how many Borg we're dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw at least thirty...and there are twenty-two Enterprise crewmembers reported missing... including Commander Data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to assume they've been assimilated into the Collective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data's positronic net contains classified information on the Enterprise. Command codes, security protocols...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they control Data, they control the ship. A grim beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't worry about that right now. Let's concentrate on what we can. They stare at the schematic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To control the Enterprise, they'll have to gain access to one of two locations. Main Engineering... or the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to cover both possibilities. (to Troi) We'll take care of the Bridge. Worf, take your men and seal off Main Engineering. Turn it into a fortress -- nothing gets in. Worf nods and EXITS. As Riker and Troi exchange a tense look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital is completely LIT UP -- the only building in town with this much power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard walks down the hall, stops outside a door marked "X-RAY PROCESSING." The RED LIGHT is on above the door, but that means nothing to Picard... who opens the door and steps inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much like a traditional darkroom, trays of chemicals and washes, etc. But everything has a slightly futuristic and cobbled-together feel. They are developing X-rays by hand instead of by machine. The room is lit with an AMBER glow. As soon as Picard opens the door, we hear Ruby's voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut that door! Picard quickly shuts the door behind him, looks around the room. Ruby, who's working at a tray of chemicals, turns around in fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, an idiot? Didn't you see the red light was on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... yes... but, I didn't realize that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God this plate was already fixed. She pulls down a small pane of glass (probably from a window) out of a tub of water... holds it up to the light. And there on the glass is a X-RAY of a man's SKULL. Picard moves to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: X-ray) Cochrane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... and I only had enough silver halide for one shot. So you're lucky you didn't screw it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry. She glances at him, sees he feels genuinely bad. She softens a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. She picks up a rubber squeegee and carefully starts to dry off the pane of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you need something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I wanted to ask you about some photographs I saw out at the silo. There were three of them... printed on some kind of fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed sheets. (off his look) I used my last set of bed sheets to make those prints. Not the best material, but I haven't seen a clean piece of paper in five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you take any other pictures of the rocket? The X-ray is now dry, and Ruby turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (jokingly) Why, did you want to buy them? Picard doesn't realize she was kidding -- jumps on the opportunity to get the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I don't have any money right now, but I may be able to get some. Ruby looks at him for a moment -- is he serious? She gives him a curious smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Money." So you can get dome money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to try real hard. No one's used currency in over ten years. What are you, from another planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard hesitates, smiles at her, tries to laugh it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... but sometimes I feel that way. (beat) What I meant was, I'd be willing to trade for the photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trade. Okay. The photographs... for a straight answer. (beat) Who are you? And how do you know Zephram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old friend... I met him when he was doing his undergraduate work at Cornell back in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) 'Fraid not. Ruby walks past him with the X-ray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard follows Ruby out into the corridor. She has a satisfied smile on her face -- it's not easy to put one over on this woman. And the truth is, she's enjoying Picard's frustration. As they walk along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casual) You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not someone who lies very easily... so it's obvious when you do... at least to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always sucha good judge of character? She stops, turns, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always. Ruby turns and walks off. Picard follows her, doggedly determined to get those photos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly is holding the X-ray glass Ruby made up to the light, as the Doctor seen earlier looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The occipital fracture is widening... we're going to have to fuse the bones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little worried about some of these bone fragments. If they move any closer to the brain, we could be looking at a hemorrhage. As Beverly and the Doctor examine the X-ray, we MOVE TO Ruby, who's looking down at Cochrane. He's still in bed and on a respirator. She smoothes his hair with affection. Picard stands on the other side of the bed, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were the two of you... involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... not like you and Doctor Crusher used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) How did you know about that? Ruby looks at him with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. Her smile widens, and then she leaves the bed to join the Doctor and Beverly. Picard shakes his head and smiles after her -- chagrinned and amused at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doctor) We can't take any more X-rays until I can mix up a new batch of the silver halide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it tonight? We may have to operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It'll be ready by morning. Ruby turns and heads for the door. Picard moves after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby... I need to talk to you about those photographs. It's  very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it is. But it'll have to wait until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't wait until tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. (beat) Besides, it'll give you all night to think up a new set of lies. She flashes him that smile again, then darts out the door. Picard is left frustrated -- he knows that he can't let it go at that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf and a team of TEN SECURITY GUARDS are preparing for battle. They're setting up large, heavy-duty phaser equivalents of machine guns --  big, mean-looking weapons on tripods. There are two of these weapons aimed at each entrance to Engineering. The Security Officers are strapping on body armor, checking weapons, building makeshift barricades over each of the doors. Worf is in command, directing the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to team) Double check each assault phaser... make certain that the range setting is no more than thirty meters. We don't want to blast through the hull. Worf turns and picks up his BAT'LETH SWORD off a nearby console. He checks the sharpness of the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't want something a little more... sophisticated, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your post, Lieutenant. The Lieutenant decides not to pursue the matter and moves off. Worf makes a quick practiced motion with the sword... decides he's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker and Troi watching the schematic. Riker works a control and the display ZOOMS IN to display a cutaway view of the ship highlighting Engineering and the surrounding deck. A SWARM of DOTS representing the Borg is advancing on Engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to com) Riker to Engineering. Mister Worf...the Borg are approaching your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. We're ready. Riker and Troi watch as the DOTS move closer... closer...right up to the perimeter of Engineering. The dots begin surrounding Engineering -- which looks like it's being swarmed over by a sea of ants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before. The security guards have taken positions around the room, all weapons trained on the doors. Worf is standing in front of the warp core, Bat'leth in- hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) Charge weapons! A massive HUM of power fills the room as all of the phaser weapons begin charging. It's tense -- everyone standing ready with their weapons charging. This is the moment of truth. Worf stands ready, phaser in one hand, Bat'leth in the other. This is Worf at his purest -- the warrior ready for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker and Troi, as before, watching the schematic of the ship. The DOTS representing Borg have now completely surrounded Engineering on all sides, including the deck directly above and below. In essence, the Borg have cocooned Engineering from the rest of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before. Worf and the security team in their positions, tense. A few beats of silence...then they start to hear soft SCRATCHING coming from somewhere behind the walls -- it sounds like rats skittering through the walls and ceiling of an old house. Everyone stays alert, checks and re-checks their weapons... a couple of hard swallows... then from somewhere up above a LOUD, METALLIC CLANG. Then a large, SCRAPING SOUND that seems to start at one end of the room and travel to the other. There's an overpowering sense of creatures just outside those walls, moving about. It's unnerving, even for crack Starfleet troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker and Troi watching the display. The Borg dots teeming around Engineering like ants on a candy bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clawing, skittering, clanging noises increase and get louder... ... we expect to see the Borg bursting into the room at any moment. Worf tightens his grip on his Bat'leth, teeth bared. Unbearable tension and then... The noises begin to FADE AWAY... eventually disappearing all together. If anything, the silence is even scarier. Worf's eyes narrow. He looks around the room, all his senses alert, waiting for the slightest sign of the Borg... but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker and Troi react to the diagram as the Borg dots begin moving away from Engineering. It looks like the swarm of ants have left the candy bar and are on the ground, moving toward the forward part of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're bypassing Engineering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are they going? OFF the mystery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DATA'S FACE. His eyes are closed -- he is in the android equivalent of sleep. CAMERA ROTATING and PUSHING IN on his face as we hear the overlapping sounds of VOICES from Data's past -- Picard, Riker, Troi, the Enterprise crew, aliens he's met, Data's own voice... bits and pieces of his life... The theme of the sound bites should be Data's quest for humanity: Picard giving him advice, Troi counseling him, Soong talking to his son, etc. The last line of dialogue we hear is Data saying "I want to be more human."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data... Data's eyes fly open, now awake. We PULL BACK revealing that Data is still strapped to the Borg operating table... his right arm and shoulder are encased in some kind of strange cybernetic SHELL, obscured from view. Clear tubes run out of the shell into Borg machinery -- liquid is coursing through the tubes. A couple of Borg drones are moving about the room, carrying out various tasks. There's been a change since we've been here last. There are now several Plexiglass CYLINDERS surrounding Data's table -- each of them filled with some kind of murky red fluid, which is swirling around. Every once in awhile, something that looks like RAW FLESH bumps up against the clear Plexiglass, then disappears again. We don't know what these tubes are for, but they're definitely creepy. Data takes all this in, but there is nothing he can do, he's still immobilized. Suddenly the table ROTATES and begins to MOVE up toward the mist and cabling at the top of the ceiling. It stops a few feet away... and Data finds himself face-to- face with the Borg Queen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've taken your first step toward perfection. How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know what you are referring to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you haven't been properly... stimulated yet. A WHOOSH of hydraulic power signals another movement by the Borg Queen. She slithers through the air and down slightly, so that she is on the same level as Data. She looks at the cybernetic shell that is encasing Data's right arm, which OPENS at her silent command and moves away... We can now see that all of the skin has been removed from Data's right arm, showing the INNER-WORKINGS of his android limb -- circuitry and servos, etc. But on the top of the mechanical forearm there is something new -- a small PATCH of HUMAN FLESH held in place with various nasty-looking hooks and clamps and small tubes carrying blood. It's a delicate, fragile piece of organic life on an ugly, mechanical surface. Data looks down at the patch of flesh with a little puzzlement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: flesh) Do you know what this is, Data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would appear that you are attempting to graft organic skin onto my endo-skeletal structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a cold description... for such a beautiful gift. She smiles slightly, utterly confident. She leans her face in close to Data's still immobilized right arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are so close to the patch of flesh that we can see the individual hairs. The Borg Queen's LIPS move into frame, and she EXHALES a long and sensuous breath. We see GOOSE BUMPS form on the skin, and the hairs stand straight up in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Data's eyes widen and he looks down at the skin in surprise -- this is a sensation he's never felt before. The Borg Queen sees the look on his face and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that good for you? Data can barely describe the sensation. But clearly, it was pleasurable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was... interesting. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it again... please. As she smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny, single-story house -- one or two rooms at the most, in serious need of repair and maintenance. No yard. The house sits on dirt. The nearest other structure is at least a hundred yards away. A very solitary place. The windows are dark, painted over from the inside. Some large pieces of exotic-looking EQUIPMENT are sitting off the front porch. After a beat, the front door opens, letting out a soft, feeble light. Ruby steps out onto the porch, carrying a gallon size plastic jug. The light from the house now lights the  equipment a little, giving us a better view. There's a contraption that appears to be a PUMP of some kind, with a funnel on top, spigot at the bottom, and several stages of filters and tubing in between. Ruby sets the jug underneath the spigot... then sits down for a  moment on the edge of the porch. She takes a breath and runs a hand through her hair, stretches her back, trying to work out some of the kinks in her neck. An exhausting day.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: is watching her intently from afar. He's concealed behind a supporting beam of one the town's many WINDMILLS. He's in shadow, hidden from Ruby's view.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: pulls off her jacket. she's wearing a pull-over shirt... and in one motion she pulls off the shirt, revealing only a tee-shirt underneath, sleeves torn off long ago. She stands up... kicks off her boots... undoes her pants... and begins sliding the jeans off her hips...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: is surprised. Glances around, a little awkward. This really isn't why he came out here.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: kicks aside the jeans. She's now down to tee-shirt and panties. She grabs the bottom of the tee-shirt... pulls it off...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: doesn't want to look, but can't help himself...

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: moves to the side of the porch... and steps into a large ENVIROMENTAL SUIT, a bulky one-piece with gloves and helmet attached.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: is a little relieved... keeps watching...

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: has now encased herself in the thick, rubbery suit... pulls over a HELMET with a gas mask. She walks over to an OIL DRUM marked with a distinctive BIO-HAZARD SYMBOL. She carefully opens the lid... takes a metal pitcher... reaches down into the drum and scoops out a pitcher-full of TOXIC WASTE. She closes the lid, walks over to the pump-filter contraption. She pours the sludge-like waste into the funnel...primes the pump... makes a few adjustments to the filters... and then turns the spigot... After a beat, a trickle of CLEAR LIQUID starts to come out of the spigot. Ruby steps back and pulls off the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: watches, curious about what she's doing...

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: is now out of the bio-suit again... pulling on her shirt and jeans... grabs her jacket... turns off the lights in the house, and shuts the front door behind her. She begins walking toward the windmill.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: steps behind the girder, stays very still in the shadows... waits quietly as Ruby passes by the windmill without a glance and heads into town. After she's gone, Picard steps out from his hiding place, watches her go, then quickly heads for Ruby's house...

dialogues.speaker: FRONT PORCH
dialogues.text: Picard opens the front door and goes inside... but he doesn't notice that at the base of the doorjamb a small RED LIGHT starts flashing -- some sort of silent alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard ENTERS and closes the door behind him. It's dark. He fumbles around for a light switch... finally locates one... and a soft, golden glow fills the room. The house has only one room, which functions as a living room, kitchen, bedroom, etc. This is also Ruby's DARKROOM. The windows have been painted black, and there are photographic plates and futuristic photo- equipment all around. But the most striking feature of the house are the large, hanging cloth-printed PHOTOGRAPHS. They vary in size and shape. Some are hanging on walls, others hang from the ceiling in mid- air, still others are stacked on the few pieces of furniture that's here. The absence of paper has forced Ruby to print photos on anything she can find -- bed sheets, shirts, pieces of upholstery, backs of carpeting, etc. Picard stands there for a moment, taking in the scene -- he's never been in anyplace quite like this. The cloth photos give the room a feeling of a small, intensely personal gallery. Picard moves around the room, looking from photo to photo... hunting for the elusive shots of the missile silo... and as he does, we get our first close look at Ruby's images, and they tell us a great deal about her... She has an artistic eye for finding beauty in the mundane and the ugly. There are pictures of hope amidst despair... beauty amongst devastation. There seems to be a theme running through the photographs -- a romantic, almost idealistic sense of optimism. At one point, Picard finds a photograph he recognizes. It's the rusted-out hover car she photographed on the streets of Resurrection. It's an ugly, decrepit piece of junk... but there in the center, spot-lighted by a single ray of sunshine... is a tiny flower about to bloom. Picard takes in the image for a brief moment... then pushes onward... goes to a file of photos sitting in a box... begins sorting through them quickly... we see PRE-WAR photos printed on real paper. They show a younger Ruby with her parents... Resurrection the way it used to look... Ruby with a dog... Picard pauses, frowns... gets the odd feeling that someone is watching him. He turns around to see...

dialogues.speaker: HIMSELF
dialogues.text: A three foot PHOTOGRAPH OF PICARD is drying in the air behind him. Ruby must've taken the photo when Picard was on the street talking to Scrimm. It was taken through a telephoto lens, a close-up of Picard's face -- he looks focused, determined, heroic. It's a remarkable shot of the Captain, and even Picard is a little taken aback by the image. She's captured the essence of the man. CLICK-CLACK! The sound of a shotgun being cocked. Picard freezes... slowly turns around to see who's there...

dialogues.speaker: RUBBY
dialogues.text: is standing in the open doorway, a shotgun leveled at Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should pay closer attention to those little red lights. Picard glances down at the doorway, sees the flashing red light in the doorjamb. He's busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'd be perfectly justified in shooting you right now. Picard glances at the photograph of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flatter yourself. I take pictures of a lot of junk. She perches herself on the arm of a small couch, holds the gun loosely, but never taking the aim away from Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's hear it. I'm sure you have a great explanation for why those rocket photos are so important you broke into my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to repair Doctor Cochrane's ship. It's been damaged and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myself... and a few other friends of Zephram's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends from Cornell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie. That's one. Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A key piece of the ship has been destroyed... and our only hope to reconstruct it is if one of your photographs shows us what it looked like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers) All right. Truth. I believe that one. Why is it so urgent you couldn't wait until morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to launch his ship by tomorrow afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or...? Picard has to come up with something -- decides to throw her off with a high-tech explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the shielding around the plutonium core will begin to deteriorate. Within a day, the entire silo will become so radioactive that no one will be able to come near it for a hundred years. Ruby eyes him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie. That's two. One more, and I pull the trigger. Picard is starting to get angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so difficult? All I'm asking for is to look at one of the photographs. It'll take five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all I'm asking for is the truth. That would take five minutes. (beat) For all I know, you caused the explosions at the silo... and now you're trying to steal Zephram's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a thief... Ruby's had enough -- her temper flares and she gets off the couch, takes a threatening step toward Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're a petty burglar and a liar... (beat) You're no friend of Zephram's. He is a great man. He's not like you or me or any of the other zombies walking around this town. Picard jumps in with a quiet, forceful quality:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's a man with vision. He can see beyond the problems that surround us. He knows there's a better future out there for everyone... a future where crime, poverty and war are things of the past... a future where we reach out and seek our destiny in the stars. (beat) I believe in that future, too, Ruby. I believe in it in every fiber of my being. And I'm telling you... if we don't launch that warp ship tomorrow, there's a very good chance that future will never happen. She eyes him for a moment -- and we're not sure if his words have had any effect. Ruby still has her doubts, but decides to go with her gut...and finally hands him the photographs. Picard glances through them -- his expression tells us the photo he needs is in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't regret this. They share a look... and then Picard turns and walks off into the night. Ruby watches him go... and we can see on her face a confused jumble of mixed emotions. Something about that man has touched her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telescopic, green and white image of Picard walking away from Ruby's home.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT SCRIMM
dialogues.text: is watching Picard through a set of night vision binoculars, perched on the roof of a nearby building. He frowns, wondering what Picard is up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant DEFLECTOR ARRAY at the front of the ship -- a giant, round, bowl-shaped array used for communications and shielding. As we watch, FOUR HATCHES OPEN surrounding the dish and BORG start to emerge from the interior of the ship and CRAWL OUT on the hull. The Borg do not need pressure suits or breathing equipment -- they crawl around the hull with ease and onto the deflector dish... PULL BACK TO REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Riker, Troi, Worf and N.D.s are watching this image on the Viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appear to be modifying the deflector dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To do what? If they wanted a weapon, they could've taken over a phaser bank or torpedo bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deflector dish... why the deflector dish...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense. The deflector is only used for shielding and long range sensors... Riker stares at the screen... notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer -- magnify grid twenty- one alpha. The image on the Viewscreen ZOOMS IN to a specific point on the deflector dish, giving us a clear view of two Borg who have opened a gigantic panel on the dish. They appear top be modifying power conduits in some fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're re-routing the deflector power conduits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer -- thermal enhancement. The image now is overlaid with an INFRARED VIEW of what they're doing. The power conduits are glowing bright red, very hot -- we can see the heat signature travel back behind the dish and connect to a corkscrew-shaped coil, which is pulsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're connecting the conduits to subspace communications...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) They're converting the deflector dish into an antennae...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They may be trying to send a message to the other Borg...the Borg in this time period...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) If it was me... I'd say "attack Earth now... in the 21st century... they'll be too strong in the 24th." They think about this for a moment as they watch the Borg swarming on the deflector array.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stop them from sending that message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. Options?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy the deflector dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we aim our dorsal phasers at it? Riker shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost control of all weapons systems... Transporters are down... we can't get to a Shuttlecraft... and it would take us too long to fight our way down to deflector control... They think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another way, Commander. Do you remember your zero-G combat training? Riker looks a little wary at the suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember it made me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Worf) What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Mister Worf is suggesting that we go outside for a little stroll... OFF their expressions...

dialogues.speaker: A PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: Another one of Ruby's cloth-printed photos, this one a clear view of the base of the missile engines -- Cochrane standing underneath the massive rocket nozzle. Above him on the fuselage is the crucial throttle-valve assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost afraid to say this, Captain... but I think it's going to work. MOVE TO REVEAL we're in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cloth photo is hanging from a beam on the catwalk. Geordi and Picard are watching a couple of N.D.s attach the newly-built throttle assembly to the side of the ship. The N.D.s are using high-tech welding tools and sparks are flying. As they talk, they head back up the catwalk toward the control room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's you get the alloy for the throttle itself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used copper pipes in their plumbing... so I melted it down... and fused it with some tritanium from one of our phaser casings. (beat) It's not the strongest alloy... but it's better than all this crude aluminum and steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Geordi and Picard ENTER. Lange is checking out a launch console. The room is now humming with power -- it's beginning to look like the place is up and running. Picard stops near the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Lange -- have you brought the computer systems back on-line yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain. This trinary language is pretty archaic... but I think I understand it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. As they speak, CAMERA MOVES in on the metal canister of lotion Picard set on the desk earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrimm and three militia guards are huddled around a cluster of military surveillance gear, listening to Picard and Geordi's conversation. Far in the distance, we can see the missile silo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we on schedule? The Vulcan ship will be here in less than two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be tight, but we should make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about our warp signature? It has to be strong enough for them to detect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've enhanced the plasma injectors -- don't worry, they'll see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, with any luck... the Vulcans will land outside Resurrection tomorrow morning... and Earth will never be the same again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrimm and his men listen with growing alarm -- it sounds like Picard is planning an invasion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'd better start familiarizing myself with the flight controls. A console BUZZES. Lange moves to it, and activates a small color video MONITOR. It shows an external view of the MISSILE silo, just outside the hatch. Beverly can be seen standing nearby with a now conscious Zephram Cochrane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Crusher's at the access hatch, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her in. Lange hits a couple of buttons...

dialogues.speaker: COCHRANE'S FACE
dialogues.text: A short time later. His head is bandaged, and he's conscious, but frankly he looks like hell. He sits back, looking a little overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight... you're from the future... I'm about to change history... and all I have to do is sit here and let you fly my ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Geordi and Beverly are standing around Cochrane, who is sitting in a high-backed chair in a corner of the Control Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He studies their faces -- sees they're serious. He smiles a little ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And people say I'm crazy... Picard smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you, Doctor, that after today... no one will ever call you that again. Cochrane considers them...finally nods, what the hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do me a favor... bring my ship back in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a promise. Picard turns and walks off with Beverly. Geordi moves to Cochrane with a little bit of awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor... my name is Geordi La Forge. I'm an engineer. Can I shake your hand? Cochrane is touched by Geordi's obvious respect. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could go with you. Is there anything I can do to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really... but I do have about a thousand questions I've always wanted to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since time is short... why don't you pick the top ten and fire away? Geordi smiles...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND BEVERLY
dialogues.text: have moved to another part of the room. Beverly looks exhausted. She sets her medkit on a table and plops down into a chair. Mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You actually performed surgery...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an experience. Metal scalpels... needle and thread... She looks up with a smile, pulls a small DEVICE out of the medkit -- a surgical transporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: device) But I had a little help. Surgical transporter. I used it to beam out most of the bone fragments from his brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did Doctor Almack react to that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so confused by what I was doing, I don't think he even noticed. (beat) Any word from the Enterprise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they're still up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) If they're not... we'd better get used to living in Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (light) That might not be so bad... at least for you. She's kidding, but Picard is a little defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? There is no animosity or hint of jealousy in Beverly's attitude, she's simply making an observation about someone she cares about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the way you looker at her... and I know that look. Picard doesn't want to argue about this -- to him, it's a pointless conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regardless of how I may feel about Ruby... our fates lie along different paths. Nothing can change that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some advice? Don't do this again. (off his look) You know exactly what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly, there were many reasons why you and I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd call them excuses. And the first excuse on both our lists was our "sense of duty." We convinced ourselves that it was more important than anything else. And you know what? It's not. She holds his look for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (neutral) I have a ship to launch. Picard turns and leaves. Beverly watches him go... wondering whether her words had any affect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby is turning off the spigot on the filter-pump. The plastic jug is now filled with the clear fluid -- silver halide. She caps the jug, picks it up, begins walking up on the porch...then hesitates for a moment... looks out over the horizon. She hesitates... then frowns and goes inside... Ruby comes inside, sets down the jug... begins to pick up some more glass plates... stops... thinks... looks up. Only a few feet away is the large picture of Picard. She doesn't want to look at him, doesn't want to think about him... but there he is. She glances back at the open door... struggles for a moment... then makes a decision. Despite herself, she can't get Picard out of her head. With a little frustration, she grabs her camera bag and heads for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in Earth orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON CEILING as the Borg Queen descends from her nesting place down towards the camera... ultimately stopping just a few feet away. She speaks directly to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: DATA'S HAND
dialogues.text: His right hand is made of FLESH -- it has color, fingernails, hair, sweat. It's completely human in every way. His fingers move slightly, and then the hand begins to rise. We follow his hand as it comes up and touches his FACE, which is also FLESH. The gold color is gone, his hair is tousled and natural-looking. Even his eyes are real now -- blue. He touches his face tentatively, his expression confused... but intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Borg Queen descends closer. Data's arms are now free, but he is still restrained on the table. The rest of his body is still android, mechanical. Data touches his two hands together, feeling the sensations, flesh against machine. He touches his face and lips, discovering himself in a totally new way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My internal sensors tell me the ambient temperature in the room is ten point two degrees Celsius... (wondrous) But my skin tells me it is cold. As he talks, we can see that he's becoming seduced by his own newfound senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My visual acuity has been reduced by seventy-eight percent... and I can no longer perceive light beyond the ultraviolet or the infrared... (beat) But I can see. It's an amazing moment, Data riding a wave of feeling and emotion like he's never had before. The Borg Queen watches, pleased. She hovers close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until today... your emotions were trapped inside an artificial shell. You didn't know what it was to truly feel. (beat) And there's so much more for you to experience.  I will guide you into a world of sensation unlike anything you can imagine. (beat) All you have to do... is give us access to your neural net. Data looks at her, suddenly shocked back into reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I will not betray my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not your friends... they've held you back... kept you from your destiny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not true. They have tried to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they given you what I have given you? Did they even try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... do not want this... But his words have a certain hollow quality to them. He is no longer as convinced as he was before and the Borg Queen notes this immediately. She reaches out with a hand and gently strokes Data's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're becoming more human all the  time, Data. Now you're learning  how to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to... go back to the way I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More lies. She SLAPS him hard across the face. Data feels the pain, the shock. A small trickle of blood comes from his mouth. He looks at her in surprise, but before he can say anything she moves forward and KISSES him on the mouth deeply and intensely. It's a disturbing and erotic moment. She pulls back. Data reels, trying to sort out the rapid succession of pleasure and pain. Her voice drops to a whisper and she moves even closer to him, face-to-face... seductive... beguiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever know a woman? Do you know what it's like to feel her breath on your face... her skin against yours... flesh against flesh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My creator did not intend for me to experience these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your creator now. She rubs her body against his, cat-like... then pulls him to her and kisses him deeply. Off the image of their bizarre embrace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker, Worf, and three Security N.D.s are pulling on SPACESUITS. The suits are form-fitting, sleek, no bulky oxygen tanks. The helmets are the same -- they conform to the contours of the skull and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Riker) You will have to realign the targeting array of the quantum torpedo... and reprogram the warhead for the localized detonation. (beat) There's only one torpedo left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'd better get it right the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) The Borg will undoubtedly attack. Set phasers to rotating modulation. The Security Officers check their phasers and wait as Riker and Worf finish putting on their suits. Riker straps a tool case to his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? Everyone nods. Riker goes to a wall panel and activates the control. The Airlock door seen earlier OPENS. Riker turns back to Troi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. Riker nods. Then he, Worf, and the Guards ENTER the airlock and Troi close the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny room separating the Bridge from the outer hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depressurize. Worf hits a control and the room DEPRESSURIZES with a HISSING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others) Activate magnetic constrictors. They all activate controls on their wrists and there is a faint hum of power as the suits are magnetized. Riker hits another control and the OUTER AIRLOCK DOOR SLIDES OPEN, revealing the vast vacuum of SPACE. They begin to walk out of the airlock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Riker and his team come out of the airlock on the top of the saucer section. It's a spectacular sight as the small group of figures, with weapons at the ready, marches toward the leading edge of the saucer. The scene is lit by light reflected by the Earth, which hangs above the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155   ON RIKER & WORF As they approach the edge. Worf gives a hand signal and the rest of the team spreads out into a tactical deployment and drops down onto their bellies. They crawl up to the very edge of the saucer and pause. Worf looks at Riker, who looks a little queasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Riker) Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little queasy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to look at the stars... keep your eyes on the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Commander, whatever you do... do not vomit in your exo-suit. It would be... unpleasant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind. Riker takes a few deep breaths to steady himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) Over and under! They all quickly scramble over the edge and onto the underside of the saucer. The CAMERA ROTATES AND SPINS with them as they traverse to the underside of the hull -- they're upside down relative to their previous position, but there's no up or down in space and their magnetized suits hold them to the hull. It's a dizzying moment as we try to orient ourselves to their new position. From this angle, the Enterprise appears to be upside down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they're on the underside of the saucer, they can see the rest of the ship laid out above them.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POV
dialogues.text: The deflector dish (which is now above us) is covered with dozens of Borg drones, who are working to modify it. Some of them turn and see us.

dialogues.speaker: RIKER AND WORF
dialogues.text: Begin running toward the torpedo tube on the saucer. (Running is difficult, they must keep one foot on the hull at all times.) Several Borg PHASER SHOTS whip past them as the Borg open fire.

dialogues.speaker: THE BORG
dialogues.text: A DOZEN of them leave the work on the dish and begin skittering down (which is normally up) the interconnecting dorsal on all fours toward our heroes like a swarm of ants -- a frightening sight.

dialogues.speaker: A SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Is HIT by a phaser shot and goes FLYING OFF into space.

dialogues.speaker: THE TORPEDO TUBE
dialogues.text: Riker reaches the opening to the torpedo tube, bends down and opens the hatch. Borg phaser shots hitting all around him. The open hatch cover provides some protection from the Borg fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf! I'm going to need at least five minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood! Worf and his team lie down on the hull and begin exchanging fire with the approaching mass of Borg. They pick off a few Borg, who also go FLYING into space. As Riker begins to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick cuts: -- Picard and Geordi strapping themselves into the Phoenix cockpit. -- In the Control Room, the Starfleet N.D.s put on 21st century headsets to communicate with the Phoenix cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Cochrane sitting in his chair, holding his head, but rapt with attention. Beverly checking him with her MEDKIT, which is sitting open on a console nearby. -- The BLAST DOOR begins closing. -- Geordi's hands flipping switches, working the controls. OVER THESE SHOTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATR setting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Active.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main bus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Initiate pre-ignition sequence. -- The Phoenix ENGINES at the base of the ship begin spewing nitrogen gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security N.D.s moving about the control room, which is now humming with power. The huge steel blast door separating the control room from the silo has been CLOSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-ignition sequence complete. Going to internal power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) Acknowledged, Phoenix. You're on internal power and ready for lift- off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final launch sequence checks... complete. Ready to begin final countdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (works) Understood. Begin five minute countdown on your mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Geordi making final adjustments to the control panels. Both are wearing 21st century communications headsets. Picard exchanges a look with Geordi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to make a little history?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix to control. (hits a control) Initiating five minute countdown... mark. A few monitors in the cockpit indicate that the countdown is underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lange and the other N.D.s watching the countdown. Suddenly a console BUZZES. Lange goes to the monitor seen earlier, hits a switch -- the monitor comes alive, shows that Ruby is now standing outside at the hatch. Lange reacts in surprise. Picard and Geordi working the controls, watching the readings, etc. We hear Lange's com voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix, we have a problem out here. There's a woman at the outer hatch... says her name's Ruby Sloan and she wants to see the Captain. Picard and Geordi react -- her timing is pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't let her in... she'll see Cochrane isn't making the flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave her out there. When the ship launches... she'll be killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to go back to Resurrection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a very... determined woman. (to com) Phoenix to control. Mister Lange... let her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby standing by the hatch, trying to look calm... Scrimm and three Militia Soldiers holding her at gunpoint. The hatch hisses and POPS OPEN. Scrimm shoves a gun into Ruby's side -- get going. As they start to crawl inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lange and the other N.D.s have focused their attention on the countdown. Ruby climbs down the ladder, a tense look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Sloane, if you'll have a seat, I'll let you talk to -- Suddenly, the three heavily-armed militia soldiers jump down the ladder from the hatch. One of the Starfleet N.D.s goes for a phaser, and a soldier BLASTS him backward with a spray of bullets from his automatic weapon. Everyone else freezes. A tense beat, then Scrimm climbs down the ladder and looks around the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker in the torpedo tube, frantically working. He begins to physically MOVE the torpedo tube itself like he's moving the barrel of a huge cannon... as he struggles to aim it toward the huge deflector dish...

dialogues.speaker: WORF AND THE SECURITY GUARDS
dialogues.text: are about fifty feet away from Riker. From their prone positions, they try to keep the Borg at bay, BLASTING them off the hull one by one. They have taken cover behind some outcroppings of equipment on the hull of the ship. The Borg have to cross an open field of metal to get to them, making then easy targets. Suddenly the Borg change tactics. From the deflector dish high above them, Borg begin LAUNCHING THEMSELVES directly at the Starfleet Officers, jumping off the dish and flying through the vacuum of space like paratroopers. This tips the balance. There are too many targets to defend from above and below. One of the flying Borg CRASHES into a Security Guard and a vicious hand-to-hand FIGHT erupts. The Borg SLASHES the guard's pressure suit, which DEPRESSURIZES killing the man instantly. Worf FIRES  a phaser blast into the Borg, knocking him off the hull and into space. Worf turns to Riker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, you're five minutes are up!

dialogues.speaker: RIKER
dialogues.text: swings the torpedo tube into place, aiming it at the deflector dish. He hits a control on the side of the tube... and a QUANTUM TORPEDO automatically slides up from below and LOCKS INTO position in the tube, like a panel on the torpedo and begins working on the circuitry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troi in command, watching the VIEWSCREEN, which shows a different angle of the battle on the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Borg are charging the subspace emitters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long until they can send a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About seven or eight minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer -- this is Commander Deanna Troi. Initiate self- destruct in six minutes, thirty seconds. Authorization Troi, gamma six five. Enable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countdown underway. Self-destruct in six minutes, twenty-five seconds... Monitors all around the Bridge show the countdown.

dialogues.speaker: A MONITOR
dialogues.text: which says "SELF-DESTRUCT IN 6:24...6:23...6:22..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant is examining one of the monitors. The display says "LIFT-OFF, T-MINUS 50 seconds...49... 48..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good, sir. They're on internal power. We can't stop the launch from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: blast doors) What about these doors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're locked down tight from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And those doors were made to withstand a nuclear attack. Scrimm looks frustrated for a moment...then turns his attention to Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute to launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Picard... this is Lieutenant Scrimm. I'm going to have to insist that you shut down the launch. You see, I know what you're doing... and I'm not going to just stand by and let it happen. (beat) Stop the launch, or I'll kill every one of your people out here... and I think you know who'll be first. As Picard reacts in shock... INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrimm is now holding Ruby by the arm. He shoves the com headset to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello... Ruby is scared, but trying to keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to com) Jean-Luc... remember that future we talked about? It's all that matters... (beat) Launch the ship. Picard reacts to her voice, but keeps working the controls, trying to concentrate. Scrimm draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead -- launch it. Ruby will be here when you get back... but she won't have a whole lot to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi and Picard exchange a tense look. Picard struggles. It's a difficult moment -- what does he do? The countdown clock is approaching 15 seconds...14... 13... Everything hangs in the balance -- Ruby's life, the future of the Earth, Picard's feelings, his duty... Finally, Picard reaches out hits a control -- the countdown clock stops at 11 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to com) This is Picard. I've suspended the launch sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Now, why don't you join us and we'll have a little talk? Picard unstraps himself and takes off the headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... we've got less than ten minutes before that Vulcan ship leaves the system. We've got to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll have to wait. Come on. Geordi quickly starts unstrapping himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard and Geordi stop outside the massive blast doors, which are separating them from the control room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi, can you see into the room? Geordi looks at the blast doors... and he does so, the electronic PUPILS in his eyes rotate, change shape and color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech INFRARED VIEW of the door, but we can't see through it -- it's opaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... the door's too thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Then we'll just have to assume it's still there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a tricorder. You're going to have to track my exact position in that room... Geordi moves off. Clearly, Picard has a plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker finishes working on the torpedo... he closes the panel... turns and reaches for the fire control mechanism. She glances up -- there's a BORG flying through space directly at him! Riker tries to bring up his phaser, but it's too late. The Borg SLAMS into him. Riker makes a desperate grab for the torpedo tube itself, trying to hold on, but the momentum of the Borg impact is too great -- they both tumble off into space together, away from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shocked Troi watches Riker and the Borg tumbling away into space on the Viewscreen. They are engaged in a zero-gee hand to hand fight -- an incredible sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self-destruct in three minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrimm still has the gun on Ruby. The blast door is just being lowered, revealing Picard. Geordi has returned to the Phoenix cockpit. A console separates Picard and Scrimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The invasion plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people you're calling "Vulcans"... who are they? Where do they come from? How many troops? What kind of weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi is working a tricorder furiously. We're not sure what he's doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 184   EXT. SPACE - RIKER & BORG As they tumble through the void of space, in a desperate fight. The Borg manages to get his hand around Riker's throat... begins choking him... Riker looks like a goner... Suddenly they are both enveloped in a BRIGHT BEAM OF PULSING ENERGY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troi in command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) Tractor beam engaged. We've got 'em, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prismify the beam. Get rid of that Borg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 186   EXT. SPACE - RIKER & BORG As the tractor beam from the Enterprise SPLITS in two and separates Riker from the Borg. The second beam disappears, throwing the Borg off into space, while Riker is towed back toward the hull of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ON RIKER
dialogues.text: As the beam moves him back toward the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dizzying view of the stars and the Earth as he is pulled through space.

dialogues.speaker: RIKER
dialogues.text: Closes his eyes, fighting off waves of nausea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Don't look at the stars... don't look at the stars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard still stalling for time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm) There is no invasion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer, Mister Picard. Try again. He shoves his gun against Ruby's head. The tension rises a notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. You want the truth... (beat) The Vulcans... are highly intelligent aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi working the tricorder... he can hear their conversation in the other room through an open com channel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aliens... that's what I thought. From where... Canada? The tricorder BEEPS and he smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From another planet. (beat) Oh, I almost forgot... they have green blood and pointed ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) And you know all this... because you're a space-man too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you've caught me. I am a space-man. Scrimm smirks at him -- what gall this guy has. But Ruby seems to discern some deeper meaning in Picard's words. She frowns in puzzlement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Truth... he's telling the truth... Picard looks at Ruby, and at that moment something on a console behind her catches his eye: a LIGHT on Beverly's SURGICAL TRANSPORTER is now FLASHING. No one else notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an entertaining man, Mister Picard. But you're also full of shit. Scrimm cocks back the hammer on the pistol he's holding to Ruby's head. The following happens very quickly: -- Picard reaches out his hand, trying to stop Scrimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Geordi! -- The gun in Scrimm's hand DEMATERIALIZES. Scrimm reacts in shock. -- Instantly, the gun REMATERIALIZES in Picard's outstretched hand. He quickly pushes the barrel to Scrimm's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you're full of shit. Everyone is in the room stunned by what's happened. Picard takes charge before anyone can recover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now, tell your men to drop their weapons. There's a beat, but then Scrimm sees he has little choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons... down. The other militia soldiers drop their weapons, which are quickly picked up by Beverly and a Starfleet N.D. Picard hands his gun to Lange, who covers Scrimm with it. Ruby turns to Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all -- Ruby throws her arms around him and pulls him close. He hugs her back, grateful she's alive. Ruby pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you have a plane to catch. Picard smiles and heads back toward the Phoenix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker slams into the hull and the BEAM goes OFF. He gets his bearings quickly and then RUNS toward the torpedo tube where Worf and his few remaining men are still fighting the Borg, who are about to overrun their position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self-destruct in fifeteen seconds... fourteen... thirteen... twelve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi and Picard strapping themselves back in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches the torpedo tube, pulls up the firing control mechanism, which shows a monitor screen with a cross- hair targeting display. He activates the monitor, which begins tracking over toward the deflector dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine... eight... seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard and Geordi's hands are flying across the controls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clamps a conduit into a power junction... then grabs hold of a rotating lever inside the tube and TURNS it. He ducks out of the way as the torpedo is LAUNCHED with a ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the torpedo streaks out from the saucer section and slams into the deflector dish. The dish EXPLODES in a burst of FLAME... blowing away the Borg who were working on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they IGNITE and start pouring out sheets of FLAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which is shuddering and shaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 203   EXT. SPACE - RIKER & WORF React with smiles. They did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troi and the other N.D.s react with relief. The countdown on the monitors are stopped at 00:03.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: as the concrete missile doors slide open and the Phoenix is LAUNCHED up into the sky, riding a pillar of fire and smoke. This is our first real look at the ship and it resembles an oversized ICBM with a specialized cockpit on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lange and the other N.D.s have the militia soldiers under guard. Ruby is watching the missile launch on a video monitor. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard and Geordi working the controls as the ship bounces and shakes. The g-forces push them back into their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solid rocket fuel at twenty-five thousand kilograms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Altitude fifty kilometers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering the upper ionospere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a red light on the second intake valve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore it. We'll be fine. (beat) Prepare for first stage shut-down and separation on my mark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Phoenix rockets into space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... two... one... mark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket booster SHUTS DOWN as the ship leaves Earth's orbit and coasts on its momentum. After a beat, the first stage booster separates from the ship and DROPS AWAY, leaving three-quarters of the ship in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DATA, head tilted back, eyes closed, smiling...a few droplets of WATER fall from above onto his face. He smiles wider, reveling in the sensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data is still restrained on the table, but a conduit has been placed above his head and is dripping condensation onto his face. Data is now a completely new being. His entire BODY is now made of HUMAN FLESH. It's a shocking sight -- for anyone who ever wondered what Data would look like human, we're now getting our first look.

dialogues.speaker: THE BORG QUEEN
dialogues.text: DESCENDS from her nest in the ceiling. She watches Data for a moment... rubs the moisture into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Borg in all but name. Data, although clearly enraptured with his new sensations and feelings still struggles to maintain his own sense of identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) I am... grateful for what you have given me. But I still do not wish to be assimilated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A universe of sensation is waiting for you... don't you want to explore it... with me? To his surprise, Data finds that he is becoming drawn to this strange creature and all that she can offer him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take the final step... give me the Enterprise... and we can be together... always. He struggles, but ultimately there's only one answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I cannot. Without taking her eyes away from Data, she reaches out a hand and touches a control on a nearby console. The color of Data's FACE turns an ASHEN GRAY --  as though the blood has drained from his skin. Another droplet of moisture falls and hits him on the cheek -- but this time his eyes widen in shock. The sensation of human feeling is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've deactivated the sensory inputs. That flesh on your body is just meat, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no, please... you cannot... She moves in close on him, an edge creeping into her voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must give me what I want... now. Without the deflector dish, we can no longer send for an early invasion. We must assimilate Earth ourselves. I need this ship. She hits the control, and the COLOR returns to his face. Data gasps -- filled with feeling once again. The Borg Queen runs her hand across his cheek -- her attitude seductive and affectionate once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it better like this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... but the Enterprise... my duty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is to yourself. Don't make me hurt you again... She touches the control again. Data is shocked back into his cold, android self. He's like a heroin addict being denied his "high" with the flick of a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no, it's so... empty... please... give it back... I need it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I need to control this ship. Let me into your mind. Data struggles, anguished... we've never seen him like this before... completely beaten down... finally, he nods. The Borg Queen touches the control again. A sharp intake of breath as the feeling returns to Data. And the Queen kisses him on the mouth. This time, he responds eagerly, throwing himself into the emotion of the moment. She pulls back a little, looks at him softly, passionately. Data stares back at her, breathless -- he seems to be completely in her thrall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to access my neural net... you will need to create a positronic interface. (beat) I will tell you how. OFF the Borg Queen's smile of victory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before. Picard and Geordi work the control in silence for a few moments. The ship is floating in space, now a good distance from Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to deploy the warp nacelles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they used to say... all systems are go. Geordi works his console...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two fifty-foot long sheets of metal fall away from the ship on either side of the Phoenix, revealing primitive WARP NACELLES tucked inside the craft. The warp nacelles then begin slowly extending themselves outward on either side -- the basic designs of the nacelles should be familiar to anyone who's ever seen a STAR TREK starship. This is the beginning of a long-standing architectural design element of our ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vulcans should be out there right now. We need to break the warp barrier in the next five minutes if we're going to get their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the warp core on-line. I'll lay in a heading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nacelles are charged... nuclear warhead standing by. We're ready to ignite the warp drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warp nacelles FLARE with power and the ship begins moving forward in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're SLAMMED BACK into their seats from the massive G-forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp field looks good... structural integrity holding... Picard activates a monitor which begins showing a  digital display of their speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off monitor) Speed... twenty thousand kilometers per second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is going faster... faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troi is standing outside the emergency airlock with the Ensign, who is working the wall panel. The airlock door OPENS after a beat, and Riker, Worf and One Security Guard ENTER. They're exhausted after the pitched battle. Troi smiles at them as they remove their helmets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit there was a moment there when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up a hand) Hold that thought. He turns away and then doubles over behind a console and begins vomiting off screen. Worf shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong heart. Weak stomach. A light beat, and then suddenly the entire Bridge GOES DARK -- ALL POWER GONE. Console, monitors, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost Bridge control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency override!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (works) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Borg Queen is floating in the middle of the room, surrounded by Borg consoles and technology. Data is still on the table, with some kind of specialized conduit connecting his head to a group of monitors, which are inactive at the moment. He appears to be caught up in the rapture of his new sensations, and his personal connection to the Borg Queen. All thought of his Starfleet responsibilities are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Queen) I am re-routing Bridge command functions to this location. Data thinks for a moment, and the monitors suddenly COME TO LIFE and the equipment around the Queen HUMS with POWER. Information about critical Enterprise systems flows across the monitor screens -- we might recognize graphics from the Bridge displays. The Borg are now in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliminate their remaining defenses. I will send Borg to assimilate the rest of the crew. Data nods... but then one of the consoles BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts) There is a perimeter alert. A ship has entered sensor range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vulcan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Data tilts his head and --

dialogues.speaker: A MONITOR
dialogues.text: shows an exterior space shot. The image rapidly ZOOMS IN on the distant PHOENIX. The ship is racing through space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
