dialogues.text: (reacts, to Data) Give me helm control. Data nods. Another console lights up. She moves to work it herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ship turns and begins moving off at impulse speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, Picard is now steering the ship with a 21st century JOYSTICK CONTROL. The ship is moving faster and faster, trembling now, a ROAR building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing one-half light speed. The starboard nacelle's running a little hot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it... The CABIN shakes a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inertial dampers are having trouble compensating... I don't think Cochrane built this thing for comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed -- two hundred, seventy-five thousand kilometers per second. WHOOSH! A weird DISTORTION passes through the cabin like a wave, then vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no temporal shielding in here! We're starting to pick up relativistic effects!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute to warp threshold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warp ship WHIPS by... and then a moment later, the ENTERPRISE ROARS into view, chasing the tiny ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi glances out the window... does a double-take and looks back up in surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the Enterprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps combadge) Picard to Enterprise. (beat) Picard to Enterprise -- do you read me? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their com system must still be down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I feel a whole lot better with them out there. We may need some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, the Queen floating above the helm control console. The warp ship is on the monitor, getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have repaired the weapons array. Phasers are on-line. A floating CROSSHAIR appears on the monitor showing the warp ship. The Queen works the console. The crosshair moves, but refuses to lock onto the warp ship. She frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The targeting lock isn't working. Data looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not understand. The optical data network has been repaired, and all systems are functioning. The Queen works furiously, still can't get the crosshairs to lock onto the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your diagnostics are in error. I need weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) The problem must lie in the interface between Starfleet and Borg technology. Your console may not be configured to handle the data flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you configure it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. She hits a series of Borg controls on a nearby console... and the restraints holding Data to the table are RELEASED. Two Borg drones move to him... as he stands up and heads for the Queen, the specialized cable still attached to his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: closing in on the tiny warp ship. It's like a shark chasing a guppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ship SHAKING with power and acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching light speed... Geordi glances out a side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting awfully close... what the hell are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're crossing the threshold! The ship is really SHAKING HARD now -- and the compartment is DISTORTING slightly, stretching, everything becoming elongated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is STRETCHING in the familiar "rubber band effect" that tells us a ship is going into warp... but this effect is much slower. It's on the verge of hitting warp speed. The Enterprise still on their tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data is standing right next to the Queen, and is studying the Borg console intently. Two Borg drones stand nearby, watching closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I see the problem. In the blink of an eye: -- DATA WHIRLS AROUND AND SLAMS AN ARM INTO ONE OF THE BORG DRONES. The drone is knocked off its feet. -- The second Borg rushes at Data, swings his arm at Data's head. This is the same Borg with the deadly stiletto-tipped DRILL SPIKES seen earlier. The spikes TEAR into the flesh of Data's neck, drawing BLOOD. -- Data reacts in pain. He GRABS the Borg's arm and with android strength KICKS HIM IN THE CHEST at the same time. The Borg FLIES BACKWARD, causing the cybernetic ARM to RIP from its socket in a shower of sparks. -- The Borg Queen SWOOPS down at Data for the kill. But Data's too quick for her. With one swift motion, he turns and THROWS the BORG ARM like a JAVELIN across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the spikes on the severed Borg arm PUNCTURE one of the diathermic oxygen tanks seen earlier. A HUGE EXPLOSION of DEADLY GAS bursts out of the ruptured tank. The WALL of roiling gas sweeps through the entire Borg Hive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) No! She lunges at Data just as the gas envelopes them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it GOES INTO WARP -- it shoots forward and streaks away from the Enterprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Picard and Geordi are slammed back into their seats and the stars WHIP PAST the windows in the familiar warp effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data and the Borg Queen tearing and clawing at each  other amongst the spewing gas. The Borg drones try to get away, but they are SWALLOWED by the rush of gas, fall to the deck, twitching in pain. Data and the Borg Queen both fall to the deck, grappling with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it STREAKS PAST -- the warp ship flying at top speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data and the Borg Queen struggling against each other... the gas swirling around their bodies... and as it does, we see the FLESH on their bodies start to LIQUEFY and MELT AWAY in a horrific ooze of blood and skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, but the ride has smoothed out considerably, Warp stars streaking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring us about... A beat as Geordi works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropping out of warp. Out the front windows, the warp stars STOP... the ship JOLTS slightly... turns to the left... Earth can be seen in the distance. They smile. It's a moment of victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's begin the landing procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The onrush of gas is gone. But it has affected every surface of the room like an acid wash. Every piece of Borg machinery is smoking and hissing. The two Borg drones are lying on the floor, dead -- all organic matter and flesh have been dissolved from their bodies, leaving only raw mechanical skeletons. MOVE TO REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: DATA AND THE BORG QUEEN
dialogues.text: lying on the floor, still locked together. Data is a shocking image: all of his human flesh has been STRIPPED AWAY, leaving only his pure android self. His metallic skull gleams in the dim light... even his eyes are gone. His mechanical left arm is still intact, but the right human arm is completely gone. His torso is stripped of the human flesh, leaving pure android with no soft human touches. Data as we've never seen him before -- raw and mechanistic. Data rolls over... still locked around him is the MECHANICAL SKELETON of the Borg Queen. A metallic spinal column with two arms with clawed hands leading off it... and a blinking, electronic BRAIN STEM at the very top of the spine. Data throws off the grotesque form. The Borg Queen carcass writhes and claws at the air. She speaks in a flat, mechanical voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fritzed) Data... Data reaches out with one hand... grabs the metal spinal column just below the brain stem... and SNAPS IT IN TWO. The blinking brain stem FRITZES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Borg Drones moving down the hall suddenly stop... twitch... the blinkies on their bodies GO OUT... and they both FALL OVER DEAD. Their connection to their Queen severed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Borg Drone reacts... lights out... slumps over DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data releases the remains of the dead Borg Queen. He leans back a little, as though exhausted by his remarkable experience. CAMERA PULLS BACK, emphasizing the loneliness of this smoking, scorched android sitting alone in the ruins of the Borg Hive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile doors now open, the ground badly scorched from the launch. Scrimm and his militia guards are sitting on the ground, while Lange and the other Starfleet N.D. keep a watchful eye on them. Cochrane is sitting against a rock, while Beverly checks him over. Ruby is pacing, lost in thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't anyone going to say welcome back? Everyone looks up to see --

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND GEORDI
dialogues.text: standing a few feet away, tired but triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it work? Picard nods. Beverly, Lange and the N.D. look relieved. Ruby takes a few steps toward Picard.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRANE
dialogues.text: smiles up at Geordi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister La Forge... now I'd like to shake your hand. Geordi smiles and walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND RUBY
dialogues.text: stop a few feet away from each other, their eyes locked. They drink in sight of each other... there's an undercurrent of unspoken feelings and words. She smiles... he smiles back. A satisfying moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's log, March 3rd, 2063. The voyage of the Phoenix was a success... again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Townspeople along the Main Street. A sense of urgency -- something's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it appears the Vulcan ship has detected the warp signature and is now on its way to Earth. Suddenly something in the night sky catches their attention. A BRIGHT LIGHT is moving down towards the city. We now realize this is what people are reacting to...

dialogues.speaker: JUST OUTSIDE OF TOWN
dialogues.text: Just a hundred yards beyond the city limits we see the massive VULCAN SCOUT SHIP SETTLING down onto the ground. Dust flying everywhere. Windmill blades spinning wildly from the exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWNSPEOPLE
dialogues.text: squinting into the wind, trying to make out what's happening...

dialogues.speaker: ON A HILLTOP
dialogues.text: A good distance away, but with a good view of the entire scene. Riker, Worf, Beverly, Troi and Geordi watching from a distance as the Vulcan ship LANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Ruby and a bandaged, but much healthier Zephram Cochrane watching the landing. People from town are surging around them. Everyone is shocked and amazed at what they're seeing. Picard watches with satisfaction -- this is the moment he's been waiting for. Cochrane and Ruby are particularly awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: THE VULCAN SHIP
dialogues.text: settles, engines whining down... dust settling.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: moves to Cochrane, takes him gently by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Cochrane... this is your moment. Cochrane looks a little bewildered, tries to grapple with the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... they're really from another world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And they're going to want to meet the man who flew that warp ship. Cochrane looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's supposed to be me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zephram, you had the vision to build that ship when no one else on this planet could see beyond their own problems. (beat) You flew that ship... all I did was push a few buttons. Cochrane looks at him for a moment... takes a breath, nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (beat) And don't worry -- I'll keep your secret. They hear a mechanical WHIRR and a HISS of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a HATCH opens on the Vulcan ship. The townspeople behind them react with shock and fear... a few people take a step back. Picard looks at Cochrane, who hesitates for a moment... then finally takes a deep breath... and strides out toward the alien ship. A man alone about to change the course of human history. Ruby moves closer to Picard and puts her arm around him... and he puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: HILLTOP
dialogues.text: As the rest of our crew is enraptured by the moment... they glance at each other with excitement as they watch history unfold...

dialogues.speaker: VULCAN SHIP
dialogues.text: Cochrane stops a few feet away from the ship as the hatch swings completely open... light streams out into the night air... and THREE HOODED, ROBED FIGURES EMERGE. They stand across from Cochrane -- a moment frozen in time.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWNSPEOPLE
dialogues.text: watching in awe...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND RUBY
dialogues.text: watching...

dialogues.speaker: THE LEAD VULCAN
dialogues.text: pulls his hood back, revealing the familiar slanted eyebrows and pointed ears, holding himself with that austere, regal dignity we've come to associate with his race. He steps forward to greet Cochrane... raises his hand as if to wave. Cochrane raises his hand automatically, as if to wave in return... But then the Vulcan splits his fingers in the classic Vulcan greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live Long and Prosper. Cochrane tries to emulate the Vulcan hand-sign...but can't quite do the awkward finger-split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... thanks. The Vulcan cocks an eyebrow at him. The very first Alien-Human relationship is underway...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND RUBY
dialogues.text: are now surrounded by townspeople, who are watching the scene unfold...

dialogues.speaker: HILLTOP
dialogues.text: Our heroes share a glance with each other and smile, Riker taps his combadge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker to Enterprise. Five to beam up. The crew DEMATERIALIZES...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND RUBY
dialogues.text: have now moved away from the crowd... no one paying attention to them. The bright lights from the Vulcan ship cast them in a dramatic silhouette. Picard turns to Ruby. It's the moment he's been dreading. This is goodbye. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? And don't tell me San Francisco...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's a lot further than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the future, isn't it? Just like you told Scrimm. (beat) I knew you weren't from around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with humor) No... I'm from France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you're from France or Venus... just take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may be hard for you to understand... but I'm duty-bound not to interfere with you, or anyone else here... any more than is absolutely necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been interfering with my life ever since I met you. (with meaning) Don't stop now. Picard struggles... he doesn't want to do this, but he's torn between his heart and his duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby... I'm sorry. (remembering his words to Beverly) But our fates lie along different paths. A long, difficult moment... then he lets her go... turns and starts walking off into the night. She stands where she is, watching him go with tears in her eyes... Picard hits his combadge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard to Enterprise. One to... He stops where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker here. Captain, we didn't get your whole transmission. Picard turns, looks back at Ruby. Their eyes meet... and he makes the decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say again, Captain? He starts walking towards her. She sees him coming... starts running to him. She throws herself into his arms and he holds her close. They kiss. A magical moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise. Two to beam up. They DEMATERIALIZE holding each other tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving out of Earth orbit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker, Worf, Troi, N.D.s. Picard ENTERS with Ruby. Everyone reacts to seeing her there. Ruby stays in the Turbolift, staring around the Bridge in amazement. Picard takes her hand and leads her out onto the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Mister Data? Riker glances at Ruby uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Sickbay. Doctor Crusher says he can be repaired... but we have to wait until we... He glances at Ruby again, awkward. But Picard finishes his thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to our own time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then make it so. Have you determined how to recreate the temporal vortex? Picard sits in his chair. Riker hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. But Captain... are we... all going back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you'd like to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Ruby stands stock-still, staring at Worf. Worf looks up at her with a Klingon smile -- teeth and all. Ruby manages a weak smile in return, then moves off to stand next to Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge to Engineering. Mister La Forge... initiate the temporal vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving through space... and then the TEMPORAL VORTEX forms directly ahead of it, as seen before. The ship ENTERS the vortex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise EXITS the VORTEX and into Earth orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming transmission from Starfleet Command. Admiral Hayes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onscreen.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWER
dialogues.text: Admiral Hayes appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral... what's the status of the Borg fleet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been destroyed. The Borg threat is over. (beat) Are you all right? The Enterprise disappeared from our sensors for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine, sir. It will take some... time to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to reading your report. The transmission ends. Ruby turns to Picard with amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. Picard gives her a gentle smile. OFF the moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great ship entering a Starfleet SPACE DOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi is directing a work crew of a dozen engineers, as they clean up the room and repair the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a couple of N.D.s) No, no -- we'll have to rip out this entire bulkhead. We'll need new bracing members for the deck above and below. The N.D.s move off, making notes on their PADDS. Geordi turns and sees Data standing in the doorway. He's now been fully restored to his original android self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data... Geordi moves to him, puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good as new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say that I'm back to my old self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. Geordi's smile fades a little as Data walks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her remains... are they still here? Geordi points over to a corner, where some N.D.s are about to close a storage container. Data walks over. Geordi goes with him. The N.D.s move aside, and Data looks down into the storage container. The broken, mangles pieces of machinery are all that's left of the Borg Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sending them to the Daystrom Institute for analysis. Data stares down at the remains with a haunted look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never realized how powerful an emotion temptation could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Temptation? You said in your report it was all a ruse... you were manipulating her. A quiet beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was... a unique lifeform. In her own way... nearly perfect. Geordi smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) It almost sounds like you miss her. Data looks up at him -- his expression unreadable. Geordi's smile fades. Data reaches out, closes the lid on the storage container, turns and walks out of the room. Geordi watches him go, left to wonder what Data is really feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard and Ruby walk up the familiar hilltop, and when they reach the crest, we reveal...

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT
dialogues.text: A large memorial cordoned off by a chain. A PLAQUE on the monument reads "On this spot, Man and Vulcan met for the first time... and changed the course of history. March 3rd, 2063."

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND RUBY
dialogues.text: step into view. They stare at the sculpture for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Ruby and the monument are at the gates of RESURRECTION CITY as it is in the 23rd century. This is the place where man first reached out to the stars, and the architecture has a distinctive uplifting feeling -- spires reaching up toward the sky. Shuttlecraft and aircars are taking off and landing. The tiny Western town is now a thriving, futuristic METROPOLIS. As Picard and Ruby walk towards the city hand-in- hand... FADE TO BLACK.
